programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In East Anglia, hip-hop enthusiasts Christine and Terry provide a hearty menu for their guests, before allotment owners Tim and Amanda host with a menu dedicated to their home-grown fruit and veg. Finally, Megan and Matt - who rarely spend time together in the kitchen - set off their fire alarm and have difficulty pulling things together and getting any food to the table.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Dan makes an offer on Susannah's silver tea set, and Ada's large bronze sculpture leaves him stumped. Meanwhile, at Nikolas Patrick pawnbrokers in Kent, owner Charlie finalises deals on an antique writing bureau and a diamond ring.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At Nikolas Patrick pawnbrokers in Kent, brothers Charlie and Patrick receive an Olympic torch that the owner wants £10,000 for, as well as some designer bags and a collection of antique firearms. Love is in the air for a newly engaged couple in Sheffield, and some rare footwear comes in.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet two couples who know exactly what they want and aren't afraid to say it. In the Essex countryside, Kirstie helps Tom and Lisa find a family home on a £1million budget, while in east London, Phil assists design-conscious James and Anisha, who have been searching for their first place together for almost two years.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander helps Edinburgh's Lisa and Fiona find a home near to open spaces, and Chichester couple Charlotte and Sam, who are looking to buy their first property together.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Forest Country House in Powys, Wales, where owner Paul Martin, joined by best friend and neighbour, Jayne Kirk, hopes his luxury B&B will impress.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hairdresser Mushgon Dadfar hosts the first dinner party in the Crewe and Nantwich area of Cheshire, and has high hopes for her Caribbean-themed evening. However, the guests have little time to let their meal settle before they face an energetic Zumba session.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Housewife Pip Massey welcomes the diners to her home for the second dinner party of the week in the Crewe and Nantwich area of Cheshire. As a fortysomething woman who lunches and is used to entertaining, she has high hopes that all those years of practice will make her glamorous evening a success.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Landscape gardener Darren Leech hosts the third dinner party in and around Crewe and Nantwich, Cheshire. He hopes to impress his guests with fine food, including smoked haddock and black pudding, and entertainment that involves laughing at his bottom.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Student Emma Davies hosts the fourth dinner party in the Crewe and Nantwich area of Cheshire, hoping to woo her guests with a creative menu featuring stuffed pork and a home-made gnocchi starter as well as treating them to a musical performance.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hypnotherapist Russell Stubbs hosts the final dinner party in Crewe and Nantwich, Cheshire, hoping to impress his guests with a rock-night theme. In a bid to improve his chances of claiming the £1,000 prize, he prepares a meal using British produce, before the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Part two of two. The chef continues his quest to transform the fortunes of the Burger Kitchen in Los Angeles, where tensions were running high because owner Alan Saffron had spent his son's entire inheritance on the struggling restaurant. Alan gets a wake-up call from internet critics, who he believes are trying to shut him down.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Steven Newman, CEO of department store chain Loehmann's, views his company from a different perspective when he goes undercover as an aspiring entrepreneur visiting the shops after winning a reality TV contest - and learns first-hand that the employees are the foundation of the company.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: The duo meet Karyn and Duncan, who have been arguing for more than two years about their three-bed semi in Stirlingshire. She wants to move on to somewhere bigger and better, while he loves the rural views afforded by their current home - not to mention the river at the bottom of the drive. Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer try to bring them together again by helping them decide, once and for all, whether they should sell up or stay put.(n)

programme.title: Gogglesprogs
programme.desc: Young TV viewers give their honest, inimitable and ultimately hilarious take on recent television programmes, from entertainment shows to documentaries, classic films and up-to-the-minute news stories.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Exploring life at Liverpool Women's Hospital through the eyes of male midwife Chris, a former navy trauma medic. Cameras also follow 22-year-old Kiefer, the birthing partner for his girlfriend Sophie. Following life-threatening complications during the birth of their first child, can he hold it together this time?.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Doctors treat a young woman who has been thrown from a horse, which then trampled on her, and also a woman who was hit by a car while riding her motorbike on a dual carriageway. Plus, an 11-year-old boy is brought into hospital after running into a wall at school and hurting his wrist.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Dating show hosted by Anna Richardson in which two singletons choose a date from a selection of naked people, who will be revealed to them one body part at a time. First into the studio is 21-year-old Dom from Hampshire, who has been nominated for the show by his mum, in a desperate attempt to break his dismal dating record. Dom wants to find a girl who shares his love of adventure and isn't bothered by his posh boy charm. There's also 22-year-old pansexual Izzy, who is open to dating any gender, but with so much on offer, will she make the right choice?.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz, as Jon Richardson and David O'Doherty take on guest captain Johnny Vegas and Jamie Laing. Holly Walsh joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Diners include Sherry, a 65-year-old dominatrix looking for romance. She hopes chartered surveyor and t'ai chi enthusiast John might be the man for her. Meanwhile, Hannah, 40, is looking for a man who shares her love of adventure. Could 42-year-old Christmas tree farmer Rob be her Mr Right?.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay visits family-run Luigi's in Orange County, California, where lazy shortcuts following the retirement of the owner's father have led the business to suffer. Ramsay faces the daunting task of reuniting a feuding family, before turning around the struggling restaurant, which currently has 126 dishes on the menu.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef comes to the aid of Lela's, a California restaurant that is currently being run into the ground by its inexperienced owner. Gordon tries to turn the failing business around, but faces opposition from the chef and makes enemies when he exposes the suspect behaviour of some members of staff.(n)

programme.title: Bodyshockers
programme.desc: Katie Piper meets more people who love or loathe their body modifications, including Malcolm, who is getting a skull design scarred into his skin, and a mum with a crumbling nose job who is going under the knife again to get it fixed. Sisters Karyse and Deanna plan joint nose jobs on the same day, while Georgia wants to get rid of a tattoo she got after a night out. The programme also features a woman who regrets getting her breasts enlarged from an A to a G cup, and a man with body work ambitions that are out of this world.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Dunkirk: The New Evidence
programme.desc: Documentary examining the famous Second World War evacuation of Allied soldiers - codenamed Operation Dynamo - from the beaches of Dunkirk, France, between May 26 and June 4, 1940. Recently released Ministry of Defence files reveal that, far from being absent as many historians have believed, the RAF was suffering massive losses supporting the evacuation. Operating at high altitude and deep inside France, RAF planes were halting the bulk of Luftwaffe bombers before they could reach the beaches. The files also reveal that the famous Spitfire took flight for the first time during the mission, and the agile fighter was a spectacular success.(n)

programme.title: Countdown to Murder
programme.desc: The events that led Lorraine Thorpe to become Britain's youngest female double murderer at the age of 15. She and 41-year-old Paul Clarke tortured and killed their friend Rosalyn Hunt, before smothering Thorpe's father Desmond to death with a cushion after he threatened to go to the police. The programme features interviews with Rosalyn's brother as well as detectives from the joint Norfolk and Suffolk investigation team.(n)

programme.title: The French Connection
programme.desc: William Friedkin's multi-Oscar-winning gritty urban crime drama tells the real-life story of two New York narcotics cops' attempts to bring down a French drugs kingpin. Gene Hackman and Roy Scheider play detectives James 'Popeye' Doyle and Buddy Russo who, while investigating relatively minor-league drugs pushers, learn that a massive shipment of very pure heroin is about to arrive in the city. The heroin is being imported from Marseille by Alain Charnier, who is prepared to do anything, including murdering policemen, to get his narcotics out on the streets. But, although they know it's on its way, Doyle and Russo don't know how. Additionally, they make life more difficult for themselves by their warring with FBI agent Mulderig, who's also working the case. Hickman was the stunt driver pursued by Steve McQueen in Bullitt; and was also behind the wheel for the famous chase in this movie, which was shot in real traffic(n)

programme.title: Constantine
programme.desc: Chain-smoking loner Constantine tries to buy his place in heaven by banishing Earth-bound demons back to hell. But his fate is tied up with Angela, a cop investigating the alleged suicide of her twin. Action(n)

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia(n)

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia(n)

programme.desc: Supernatural comedy set in New York about three eccentric professors of parapsychology who decide to set up a ghost-catching agency. Soon a storm of malevolent spirits threatens to destroy the city, and the mysterious contents of a woman's fridge suggest a paranormal Armageddon(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters II
programme.desc: A sequel to the 1984 smash hit, this film returns to New York City where supernatural events once again threaten the city. Although the ghostbusters have gone separate ways after being sued by the city for the damage done in the first film, Dr. Raymond Stantz (Dan Aykroyd), Dr. Peter Venkman (Bill Murray), Dr. Egon Spengler (Harold Ramis), and Winston Zeddemore (Ernie Hudson) must reunite in order to save the infant son of Dana Barrett (Sigourney Weaver) and the city of New York from an evil ghost(n)

programme.title: Dallas Buyers Club
programme.desc: Matthew McConaughey headlines director Jean-Marc Vallée's biographical drama centering on the story of Ron Woodroof, a Texas electrician who was diagnosed as HIV-positive in 1986, and who subsequently devoted his life to providing fellow HIV patients with non-FDA-approved drugs and supplements during an era when doctors were still struggling to understand the devastating disease. Defying his surprise death sentence, Woodroof set out to procure any and all non-toxic alternative HIV treatments available, and established a "buyers club" to provide the treatments to others afflicted with the disease. But that mission quickly made him a target for both the U.S. medical establishment and the pharmaceutical industry, both of which resented his defiance of government sanctions, and joined forces to shut down his operation by any means necessary(n)

programme.title: Double Impact
programme.desc: Identical twins are separated at six months and raised on different continents. They reunite twenty-five years later to avenge the murder of their parents and reclaim their stolen family fortune(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves
programme.desc: Robin of Locksley returns from the Crusades to find the Sheriff of Nottingham making life miserable for the peasants of Sherwood Forest, and recruits a noble band of allies to help him defeat the dastardly lawman(n)

programme.title: The Man From U.N.C.L.E.
programme.desc: In this spy thriller set in the early 1960s, CIA agent Napoleon Solo and KGB operative Illya Kuryakin team up to stop an international criminal organisation that is trafficking nuclear weapons and technology. Adaptation of the TV series of the same name(n)

programme.title: Into the Blue
programme.desc: While treasure hunting in the Bahamas, a group of young divers discover a wrecked cargo plane on the ocean's floor. Within lies millions of dollars of illegal drugs, and the divers' dream of finding sunken treasure has come true. But as they argue among themselves about what to do with their prize, the friends soon realize they're not the only ones interested in the narcotics. Dangerous criminals are also searching for the drugs, and now the treasure hunters themselves have become the hunted(n)

programme.title: The Box
programme.desc: Norma and Arthur Lewis are a charming, loving couple; he a research scientist at Nasa's Langley facility and she is a teacher. Early one morning a mysterious box is left at their door. Hours later, a gentleman with a badly burned face arrives to tell them that if they push the red button on top of the box they will receive one million dollars, but someone they don't know will die. They have 24 hours to choose. He will then return to collect the box(n)

programme.title: Spider-Man 2
programme.desc: Sequel to the live action adaptation of the Marvel comic strip about an alienated teen who is bitten by a genetically altered spider and subsequently develops superhuman powers. Dr Otto Octavius takes on the guise of Dr Octopus to try and defeat the superhero(n)

programme.title: Eraser
programme.desc: Armed and dangerous action with Arnold Schwarzenegger as the US Marshal assigned to protect a vital government witness from high-powered criminals(n)

programme.title: Die Hard With a Vengeance
programme.desc: Things aren't going well for John McClane: his marriage is breaking up, he's been suspended from the force and now the brother of Hans Gruber, the German terrorist he threw off a building a few years back, is threatening to blow up a school if McClane doesn't run around the city solving his demeaning and dangerous puzzles. With the help of Zeus, a Harlem electrician, McClane discovers Gruber's plot to distract the NYPD while he clears the federal bank of billions of dollars of gold(n)

programme.title: Domestic Disturbance
programme.desc: Frank Morrison watches helplessly as smooth but creepy Rick Barnes wins his ex-wife and son. Could he be a danger to Frank's loved ones? Thriller(n)

programme.title: The Take
programme.desc: In this thrilling action flick set in Paris, a maverick CIA agent forges an unlikely bond with a pickpocket as they investigate a terrorist conspiracy targeting the city's Bastille Day celebrations(n)

programme.title: Mechanic: Resurrection
programme.desc: Hitman Arthur Bishop (Jason Statham) is forced to come out of retirement and commit three difficult assassinations in order to rescue his kidnapped lover (Jessica Alba). The hardest part: He must make all of the killings look like accidents. Tommy Lee Jones, and Michelle Yeoh co-star. Directed by Dennis Gansel(n)

programme.title: The Arrival
programme.desc: Science fiction thriller in which a scientist battles to convince the authorities of an imminent alien attack. Zane Zaminski is a radio astronomer who believes he has heard an extra-terrestrial signal, but whose discovery is deemed worthless by his boss. Then his research division is closed down due to government cutbacks and he is given the sack. Undeterred, Zane establishes a makeshift radio telescope within his own home and joins forces with fellow scientist Ilana Green ( Lindsay Crouse ) to find out more about this alien life-force which, it seems, has its own plans for Planet Earth..(n)

programme.title: Scarface
programme.desc: Graphically violent drama telling the story of a Miami-based mob boss - a Cuban refugee who works his way through gangland competition and builds up a nationwide drug-trafficking empire which then collapses around him. Scripted by Oliver Stone, the film features one of cinema's most gruelling sequences, involving a chainsaw, a shower and a strung-up henchman(n)

programme.title: Pride and Glory
programme.desc: A detective's probe into the murder of four cops points to corruption and his own brother and brother-in-law, both of whom are cops(n)

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: Orin Hanner is a rich man intent on becoming richer by allowing toxic waste to be dumped into abandoned mineshafts. His scheme hits a snag when a mysterious stranger breezes into town with a guitar, a gun and a leather jacket. Action(n)

programme.title: Play It to the Bone
programme.desc: Woody Harrelson and Antonio Banderas make genial sparring buddies in this bright comedy-drama. They play pro boxers who are slightly over the hill, but have a chance to redeem their careers---if they fight against each other in a Las Vegas match. Lolita Davidovich, Lucy Liu, Tom Sizemore, Robert Wagner, Richard Masur. Directed by Ron Shelton ("Bull Durham")(n)

programme.title: Any Given Sunday
programme.desc: 'On any given Sunday you're gonna win or you're gonna lose. The point is - can you win or lose like a man?' Macho stuff from director Oliver Stone, with a cast of heavyweights from both cinema and pro sport(n)

programme.title: Zoolander
programme.desc: Ben Stiller directs and stars in this satire on the fashion industry as the eponymous Zoolander, an air-head male model who's eclipsed by the equally vacuous Hansel. But fashion designer Mugatu has plans for the ex-model; he's going to turn him into an international assassin(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Ford Fairlane
programme.desc: A vulgar but vibrant detective spoof in which a Los Angeles private eye tries to find the link between a missing girl, the murder of a heavy-metal star and the electrocution of a friend. Starring controversial stand-up comic Andrew Dice Clay(n)

programme.title: Hellboy II: The Golden Army
programme.desc: Hellboy isn't about to stand idly by as the planet is purged by a demonic despot, and with a little help from his team at the Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defence, he may just be able to send our otherworldly overlords packing(n)

programme.title: Marauders
programme.desc: FBI agents investigating a series of bank robberies initially suspect that the business's owner might be responsible, but they later realize that the heists point toward a much-larger conspiracy in this taut crime thriller(n)

programme.title: Body of Lies
programme.desc: Fresh off of their success with director Martin Scorsese's The Departed, star Leonardo DiCaprio and screenwriter William Monahan team with director Ridley Scott for this screen adaptation of David Ignatius' novel Body of Lies. When CIA operative Roger Ferris (DiCaprio) uncovers evidence indicating that a major terrorist leader may be operating out of Jordan, he enlists the aid of CIA veteran Ed Hoffman (Russell Crowe) in infiltrating the elusive saboteur's vast underground network. During the course of his dangerous mission, Ferris gradually comes to question how much he can trust his presumed allies -- who include not just Hoffman, but the outwardly helpful head of Jordanian intelligence as well(n)

programme.title: Gone in 60 Seconds
programme.desc: Nicolas Cage plays the car thief forced out of retirement to save brother Giovanni Ribisi. A slick, stylish, pelting action thriller(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Remember. As peace descends in 1945, the series ends with a sombre reminder of the human cost of the bloodiest conflict in history(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Tough Old Gut: Italy (1943-1944). Churchill described Italy as the 'soft underbelly of the crocodile', thinking the Allies could cut through it to reach Germany(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Inside the Reich: Germany (1940-1944). In the summer of 1940, the German forces are the conquerors of Western Europe, and at home the feeling is that the war is over. German cities are untouched and there is thankfulness that the carnage of the First World War has not been repeated. But, after this jubilant beginning, the German people were to be shocked into reality by future events, including the decimation at Stalingrad. Ser. 1, Ep. 16(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Japan (1941-1945). This edition looks at Japan's involvement in the conflict, and how many Japanese came to believe that their spiritual strength and discipline would prevail over the Allies. Narrated by Laurence Olivier(n)

programme.title: Weaponology
programme.desc: Submarines. The cable documentary series Weaponology investigates the science of warfare as it has progressed and developed - over the centuries - from crude battlefield contraptions to diabolically inventive weaponry. Each episode hones in on one particular category of weapon and discusses its background, evolution and strategic employment on the front lines. Episode Four, "Submarines," argues that many underwater subs carry more destructive potential than any other maritime crafts, and then underscores this argument by exploring such subtopics as the modern use of nuclear-powered aquatic torpedoes, the use of subs in undercover operations, and the evolution of these clandestine sea vessels from the German U-boats of World War II to the Virginia-Class attack subs of the 21st century that can easily exterminate entire fleets of ships with a single launch(n)

programme.title: Weaponology
programme.desc: Vertical Take Off. Explore the development of engine power, targeting system, advanced avionics and survival system of the vertical take-off aircraft(n)

programme.title: Patriots Rising: The American Revolution
programme.desc: Rise of the Patriots. Director's cut of a three-part examination of the American colonies' break from England that highlights contributions by lesser-known individuals to pivotal events, and begins with Joseph Warren, a Boston doctor who sent Paul Revere on his famous ride in April 1775; Samuel Whittemore, a septuagenarian combatant in Massachusetts; and Salem Poor, a former slave who fought at the Battle of Bunker Hill(n)

programme.title: Patriots Rising: The American Revolution
programme.desc: The Empire Fights Back. An enhanced episode profiles John Glover, a Massachusetts mariner who saved George Washington's army after the Battle of Long Island in August 1776; John Honeyman, a spy whose intelligence gathering helped tip the scales at the Battle of Trenton in December 1776; and Sybil Ludington, a teen girl who rode 40 miles to warn colonial forces about British movements in New York in April 1777(n)

programme.title: Patriots Rising: The American Revolution
programme.desc: Return of the Rebels. In an enhanced episode, Elizabeth Burgin helps POWs escape from British prison ships in New York in 1778; Peter Francisco is known for his size and strength on battlefields in Pennsylvania, New Jersey and South Carolina; and James Armistead, a slave, serves as a spy who gathers intelligence before the Battle of Yorktown in the fall of 1781(n)

programme.desc: The Abrams Tank. A look at the development of the M1 Abrams tank and how it evolved from speedy predecessors such as the American M18 Hellcat in World War II and the Soviet T-55 during the Cold War(n)

programme.title: Triggers: Weapons That Changed the World
programme.desc: The SAW. The light machine gun launched mobile warfare by blending massive firepower with the portability of a rifle. We'll look into the evolution of this revolutionary weapon(n)

programme.title: Beating the Odds
programme.desc: Included: a man requiring a lung transplant; an Olympic medallist and amputee(n)

programme.title: Against the Odds
programme.desc: Those Damned Engineers. A look at how Allied combat engineers tried to thwart German advances during the Battle of the Bulge in December 1944 by destroying roads and bridges(n)

programme.title: Against the Odds
programme.desc: The Heroes of Tarawa. In November 1943, United States Armed Forces launched a across-the-beach infantry attack on the heavily fortified Japanese-held atoll of Tarawa(n)

programme.title: Nazi Fugitives
programme.desc: Josef Mengele. Nazi physician Josef Mengele is pursued Mossad agents for decades(n)

programme.title: Nazi Fugitives
programme.desc: Kurt Lischka. The hunt for former Paris Gestapo chief Kurt Lischka, who was responsible for the deportation of 73,000 Jews, is recalled(n)

programme.title: Nazi Fugitives
programme.desc: Paul Touvier. The hunt for Paul Touvier (1915-96), who was nicknamed the "Hangman of Lyon" and ordered the execution of seven Jews as the leader of a French pro-Nazi military police force, is examined(n)

programme.desc: Franz Stangl & Gustav Wagner. SS commandant Franz Stangl and SS-Hauptscharführer Gustav Wagner, who oversaw the murder of hundreds of thousands of Jews at the Sobibór death camp in Poland, are profiled(n)

programme.sub-title: In Search of the Real King Arthur

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Inside the Cult of Satan. Jamie Theakston ventures beyond the world of orthodox religion as he probes the Church of Satan. Learn more about their philosophy as Jamie goes underground(n)

programme.desc: Bloodlust: Real Vampires. Jamie goes to Eastern Europe to investigate the mythology of vampires and their role in popular culture(n)

programme.desc: Summer Heating. Summer is coming to an end, so the Kilchers need to get ready to create their own heat, which means stockpiling firewood and using some frontier ingenuity to build a new stove(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Lost in the Forest. Pete recalls his favourite moments from the show, including high jinks with the crew and memorable jobs(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters

programme.desc: The Pirate Queen. Drag queen Frank Marino asks the duo to create an over-the-top bed tank. Meanwhile, the guys build a Pirate Ship tank in Florida(n)

programme.title: Crimewatch Roadshow
programme.desc: In Solihull, Tina Daheley reveals how West Midland Police's dog unit train their canine recruits to sniff out items, and Rav Wilding reports on DNA testing and sheep rustlers.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell explore properties about to be auctioned in Cornwall, Walsall and Hertfordshire, then talk to the buyers about their plans.(n)

programme.title: Kitchen Garden Live with the Hairy Bikers
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers are joined by singer Gregory Porter, chef Matteo Salvatore shares tips on how to make seasonal pizza, and designer Adam White reveals his show garden.(n)

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: Two jewellers in London are victims of an armed robbery, but the perpetrator soon becomes a fugitive in a high speed car chase. Meanwhile, three fly tippers are caught in the act.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Tim Wonnacott oversees proceedings as two teams search for antiques at the East of England Showground in Peterborough, with the help of experts Christina Trevanion and Thomas Plant.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker presents the latest from the All England Club, where day two continues, with the focus on the seeded players in Centre Court and Court One. The absence of seven-time champion Serena Williams means a break to the traditional Centre Court schedule for day two, but the crowd can still expect a galaxy of stars to take to the grass for the third Grand Slam event of the year, including matches from the top half of the ladies' draw and the bottom half of the men's draw. Roger Federer will be full of confidence following his recent tournament victory on grass at the Gerry Weber Open, and he begins his attempt to win an eighth Wimbledon title by facing Alexandr Dolgopolov, while Novak Djokovic, Milos Raonic, Dominic Thiem and Juan Martin Del Potro will also get their respective campaigns under way.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat, hosted by Matt Baker and Alex Jones.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Things remain tense between Sonia and Martin as they continue to argue over where Bex should live. It's Dennis's birthday but Louise's mind is elsewhere when she reveals she has had to pull out of the showcase because of what happened with Keegan - a situation Alexandra is keen to use to her advantage. Steven goes to extreme lengths to find out what Lauren is up to, Sonia and Tina reconnect, and Mick, Fi and Shirley interview for a new barmaid.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: A grieving Morven won't accept the circumstances of a close tragedy and will stop at nothing to get the truth. Meanwhile, a familiar face arrives on Keller for emergency surgery, putting Sacha in a compromising personal and professional position. And when Nina makes her presence felt on Darwin, Matteo starts to see her in a new light.(n)

programme.title: Broken
programme.desc: Father Michael visits the Demichelis children who are struggling to cope, but his offer of help is initially rejected by Chloe, whose anger results in drastic action. To her surprise, she gains support from an unlikely quarter. The inquest into Vernon's death begins, with Father Michael, Helen, and the officers in question all summoned to give evidence. PC Andrew Powell has to make a tough call - support his colleagues or tell the truth? And will being under oath lead Father Michael to confess to more than he has before? Drama, starring Sean Bean. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: As one of Britain's largest youth groups, the cadet forces are responsible for nearly 130,000 children in more than 2,000 clubs across the country. Katie Razzall investigates sexual abuse within these forces, and examines questions facing the Government organisation in overall charge - the Ministry of Defence.(n)

programme.title: Doctor in the House
programme.desc: Dr Rangan Chatterjee visits Nicola, who has been diagnosed with 10 different conditions, including fibromyalgia, ME, sciatica and depression, and her pain and exhaustion has led her to become reliant on painkillers and struggling to get through the day. The doctor also spends time with La-vern, who is suffering from stress and severe exhaustion and is at risk of developing life-threatening type 2 diabetes. Rangan must find a way to completely overhaul her lifestyle, including her diet, sleeping habits and work-life balance.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Crimewatch Roadshow
programme.desc: The team report live from the National Ambulance Resilience Unit in Wiltshire, where they see how paramedics are trained to deal with hazardous emergencies.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Lucy Alexander and Dion Dublin meet the new owners of properties in Ripley, Derbyshire, Erdington in Birmingham, and East Ham, London.(n)

programme.title: Kitchen Garden Live with the Hairy Bikers
programme.desc: Jimmy Osmond joins The Hairy Bikers live from the Hampton Court Palace Flower Show and award-winning designer Paul Hervey-Brookes gives a tour of his show garden.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces the opening matches on day three of the tournament at the All England Club, where the second round of the singles is set to get under way.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces further second-round coverage from the All England Club, where the men's and ladies' second-round singles matches are scheduled to continue. Andy Murray will be involved on one of the show courts this afternoon, and is scheduled to face Dustin Brown, who caused a sensation at SW19 two years ago when he defeated Rafael Nadal at this stage of the competition. The world number will hope to avoid a similar fate against the German as he continues his attempt to win this Grand Slam for the third time in his career, and will hope to replicate the form he produced in beating Alexander Bublik 6-1, 6-4, 6-2 in the first round on Monday.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Zoe Ball host the live magazine show, with a team of roving reporters presenting stories of interest from around the UK, plus big-name studio guests.(n)

programme.title: Watchdog
programme.desc: Nick Hewer asks if the banks are being unfair in how they handle scamming cases and a plumbing firm's outrageous overcharging is exposed. Plus, a test into whether one of the country's most familiar companies is offering new customers a service it knows it can't deliver, along with live consumer advice and the latest on stories making news.(n)

programme.title: The Week the Landlords Moved In
programme.desc: Young landlords Dan and Jamie are given a reality check in Co Durham when they move into their tenant Michael's home. At first, they are blase about the jobs that need doing, but when they come face to face with Michael everything is thrown into question. In Leeds, old feelings and difficult memories are raked up for millionaire Prab when he is taken back to his own impoverished childhood.(n)

programme.title: Room 101 - Extra Storage
programme.desc: Extended edition of the comedy panel show presented by Frank Skinner, with Richard Ayoade, Alun Cochrane and Gabby Logan competing to have their pet hates consigned to Room 101, with topics including people who laugh out loud when reading a book, fun and half and half scarves.(n)

programme.title: Bus Wars
programme.desc: Documentary looking at the fierce competition between big bus tour companies in Belfast as they fight for a share of the lucrative tourist market. Part of the Our Lives strand.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Gok Wan joins Brian Conley to revisit some classic television series of his formative years. From the magic and mystery of Japanese children's drama Monkey, to the pan-European quiz show Going for Gold, via groundbreaking, anarchic pop series The Tube, these were the shows that apparently helped shape Gok into the style icon that he is today.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Antiques experts Charles Hanson and Charlie Ross guide the red and blue teams around the Ardingly Antiques and collectors fair, where presenter Tim Wonnacott spots a rare pair of silver salt cellars.(n)

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Action from the latest fixtures, including Leeds Rhinos v St Helens, Castleford Tigers v Hull FC and Salford Red Devils v Huddersfield Giants.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Welwyn Garden City.
programme.desc: Nick Knowles meets midwife and kidney patient Sascha, who has to undergo intense dialysis sessions for hours on end, five days a week. This places the mother-of-four's body under great stress and the constant threat of blood clots gives her a life expectancy of just a few years. Determined to help, the DIY SOS team, bolstered by the local tradespeople and volunteers of Welwyn Garden City, renovate her home to include a dedicated dialysis room, offering her the chance of many more years with her family.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Jo Coburn with the latest political news, interviews and debate.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces live coverage as the second day's play at the All England Club gets under way, with the first round in the men's and ladies' singles set to continue. Weather permitting, the line-up for the second round will be decided by the end of the day, with the bottom half of the men's draw and the top half of the ladies' taking place today. Day two traditionally sees the defending ladies' champion begin the defence of her title, but Serena Williams is absent this year due to pregnancy, so top seed Angelique Kerber will be first up on Centre Court, as she faces a qualifier. Other matches scheduled to take place in the ladies draw today include Karolina Pliskova v Evgeniya Rodina, Agnieszka Radwanska v Jelena Jankovic, and Great Britain's Katie Boulter v Christina McHale. The commentary team includes Tim Henman, Barry Davies, Peter Fleming, Tracy Austin and Andrew Cotter.(n)

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents highlights of the first-round matches on day two at the All England Club, where the third Grand Slam tournament of the year continued on the grass courts. Fifteen British players entered the main draw last year, but only five made it through to the second round, including eventual men's champion Andy Murray. Plus, a look ahead to tomorrow's order of play.(n)

programme.title: Hospital
programme.desc: Cameras follow patients at St Mary's who face a long wait, including a woman with serious mental health issues. There is also footage of patients and their loved ones coping with dementia, including a wife who is her 75-year-old husband's sole carer, and is at breaking point, partly due to his aggressive outbursts.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: Dawn of the Driverless Car.
programme.desc: Exploring the artificial intelligence required to replace human drivers, focusing on issues including the ethics of driverless car crashes and the impact on jobs. Despite the glossy PR and positives such as reduced exhaust emissions, the reality is that the future of driverless cars might not be all good news.(n)

programme.title: Who Should We Let In? Ian Hislop on the First Great Immigration Row
programme.desc: As Brexit Britain prepares to draw up new rules on who is welcome in the UK, Ian Hislop explores the decades from the Victorian era to the First World War, when modern Britain introduced its first peacetime restrictions on immigration. Until then, the Victorians had an open door to foreigners, but rising numbers in the late 19th-century triggered a fierce disagreement over who should be allowed in, mirroring the ongoing modern-day debate.(n)

programme.title: The Life Swap Adventure
programme.desc: A nurse living in Nottingham whose husband is in the army has rarely settled for long in one place and would like to move somewhere with a sense of community. She trades places with a B&B owner from Alaska, who is hoping to escape her small-town life and see more of the world as she approaches retirement.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Brian Conley invites Pam Ayres to pick the TV shows that shaped her life, with the poet's selection including one of the scariest series ever broadcast on British TV.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The art of the auctioneer is examined, the show's experts give tips about buying and selling in the saleroom and there is a look behind the scenes to find out what goes into filming an episode of Flog It! Paul Martin presents.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Paul Laidlaw and John Cameron help the red and blue teams find bargains at the Royal Highland Centre in Edinburgh, while host Anita Manning explores the city's castle.(n)

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Erika Levi meets some of the athletes hoping to win medals for Great Britain at the 2017 Deaflympics in Turkey, which begin later this month.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs Selin Kiazim, Mike Reid and Tom Kemble continue the battle to cook at a Taste of Summer banquet celebrating 140 years of the Wimbledon Championships. As each of them prepare their desserts, they will all be out to impress as only two can make it through to tomorrow's London and South East final.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Including coverage of Prime Minister's Questions from the House of Commons at 12.00. Presented by Andrew Neil and Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker presents as the third day's play continues at the All England Club, with the men's and ladies' singles second-round matches scheduled to fill the famous grass courts. Among the contests scheduled to take place today are those in the bottom half of the women's draw, which will include Simona Halep v Beatriz Haddad Maia, Elina Svitolina v Francesca Schiavone, and Madison Keys v Camila Giorgi. Halep is among the favourites to lift the Venus Rosewater dish at SW19 this year, and after recording a straight-sets victory over Marina Erakovic in round one, will hope to emulate that performance today against Maia, who progressed to this match by beating Great Britain's Laura Robson on Monday.(n)

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces highlights of the third day's play from the All England Club, where the men's and ladies' singles were due to continue with round two. Places in the last 32 of each draw were at stake and the players should have got used to the pace and bounce of the grass courts by now, although the seeds are still particularly vulnerable at this stage of the tournament.(n)

programme.title: RHS Hampton Court Palace Flower Show
programme.desc: New series. Monty Don and Joe Swift take a first look at the Royal Horticultural Society's Hampton Court Palace Flower Show, and are joined by a team of experts to review the diverse range of show gardens and discover how award-winning designer Andy Sturgeon is recycling Chelsea Flower Show gardens of the past. Arit Anderson reveals the stories behind the conceptual gardens, while Carol Klein is in the floral marquee and Rachel de Thame demonstrates how to get the most out of flowering border plants.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: Hospital
programme.desc: Cameras follow patients at St Mary's who face a long wait, including a woman with serious mental health issues. There is also footage of patients and their loved ones coping with dementia, including a wife who is her 75-year-old husband's sole carer, and is at breaking point, partly due to his aggressive outbursts.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days+
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins underground at Big Pit coal mine in Blaenavon, where he discovers how Victorians toiled night and day to power the Industrial Revolution. On the River Usk, he learns about 19th-century developments in angling before heading to Ascott-under-Wychwood in Oxfordshire - once the scene of a farm labourers' dispute that ended in rioting. Michael concludes this leg of his journey at Blenheim Palace.(n)

programme.title: Britain Beneath Your Feet
programme.desc: First in a two-part documentary in which Dallas Campbell takes a unique look at Britain, exploring the hidden wonders beneath people's feet. Along the way he finds out how the Shard of London stays standing on soft clay and reveals how Edinburgh was set upon an ancient volcano. The presenter also abseils down an underground waterfall higher than Niagara, canoes along a secret river under the city of Bristol and discovers a vast root system beneath one of the nation's oldest oak trees.(n)

programme.title: The Queen Mary: Greatest Ocean Liner
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the life of the Clyde-built ship, from the maiden voyage in May 1936 to New York, and her 1939 role in the Battle of the Atlantic, to her current status as a floating luxury hotel and museum in Long Beach, California. Among the contributors are singer Johnny Mathis.(n)

programme.title: Photographing Africa
programme.desc: Photojournalist and film-maker Harry Hook captures images of some of Africa's most remote tribes and peoples in a reflective journey across the continent where he grew up. Travelling around Kenya's Samburu district - an area approximately the size of Wales - he endeavours to track down five women whom he first photographed 30 years ago, in a bid to find out how their lives have since changed.(n)

programme.title: Roger Bannister: Everest on the Track
programme.desc: On May 6, 1954, Roger Bannister became the first man to run a mile in less than four minutes. Since that day, more people have reached the summit of Everest than have matched Bannister's feat. But as this documentary reveals, before the lunchtime-trained runner could make history, he first had to survive the Second World War. His story is told by Bannister himself, as well as his rival John Landy, Sebastian Coe, and Chris Chataway, who was Bannister's friend and pacesetter - among many others.(n)

programme.title: The Brits Who Built the Modern World
programme.desc: British architects reveal how they helped craft the modern world with their vision, beginning by discussing their latest work including London's `Cheesegrater' skyscraper, Spaceport America in New Mexico and the KK100 in China. Norman Foster, Richard Rogers, Nicholas Grimshaw, Michael Hopkins and Terry Farrell were all born in the 1930s and were shaped by the optimism of the post-war years and the 1960s counter-culture, and began their careers as outsiders and radicals. They tell the stories of the designs for the Pompidou Centre in Paris, Willis Faber & Dumas Headquarters in Ipswich and Hopkins House in Hampstead.(n)

programme.title: Medieval Lives: Birth, Marriage, Death
programme.desc: Historian Helen Castor explores life in the Middle Ages, beginning with a look at the circumstances surrounding labour and birth at the time. She reveals how childbirth was one of the most dangerous experiences a medieval woman could encounter and that it took place in an all-female environment. With little in the way of pain relief, it was believed that the agony endured was punishment for the original sin of humankind.(n)

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc: David Dimbleby investigates the importance of the sea to trade and to the individual livelihoods of coastal communities. He sails along the west coast of Scotland, starting at Craobh Haven and along the Crinan Canal, a waterway designed by East Lothian engineer John Rennie to take 120 miles off the journey from the west coast to Glasgow and safely avoid the turbulent waters around the Mull of Kintyre. He also climbs aboard the last working sea-going Clyde puffer, where he earns his keep shovelling coal in the steam room, and reflects on the role played by the river in both trade and shipbuilding.(n)

programme.title: The Queen Mary: Greatest Ocean Liner
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the life of the Clyde-built ship, from the maiden voyage in May 1936 to New York, and her 1939 role in the Battle of the Atlantic, to her current status as a floating luxury hotel and museum in Long Beach, California. Among the contributors are singer Johnny Mathis.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days+
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Beginning in the heart of academia in Oxford, Michael Portillo visits the Bodleian library to see some Victorian treasures, including Mary Shelley's Frankenstein manuscript and a pocket-sized edition of Bradshaw's Companion. At Bicester, he investigates two new rail projects, finds out about Victorian philanthropy in Bedford and finishes in Luton, where he explores the dark arts of the hat-maker.(n)

programme.title: Sound of Cinema: The Music That Made the Movies
programme.desc: Neil Brand looks at how developing technology has taken film soundtracks in new directions and changed perceptions on how they should be made. He tries his hand at playing a theremin, the early Russian instrument that Miklos Rozsa used to evoke a sense of psychological disturbance in Alfred Hitchcock's movies and talks to Vangelis, who shares his inspiration for the Chariots of Fire and Blade Runner scores. The presenter also interviews Walter Murch and Carter Burwell, before Clint Mansell explains how electronic technology allowed him to become an acclaimed composer despite his lack of formal musical training. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Spies of Warsaw
programme.desc: Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais's two-part adaptation of Alan Furst's spy novel concludes. Jean-Francois Mercier's mission becomes all too dangerous when his cover is compromised while trying to unearth German military plans. After travelling to Czechoslovakia to find and question the elusive `Seagull', Mercier finds his superiors becoming increasingly frustrated with his risk-taking and lack of protocol. Anna Skarbek is devastated after she receives news about ex-lover Max Mostov and heads to Spain on mission of mercy for the League of Nations. Starring David Tennant and Janet Montgomery.(n)

programme.title: Modern Times
programme.desc: The hereditary title of duke has been bestowed by British monarchs for reasons ranging from a grateful nation rewarding a major war leader to a king acknowledging his illegitimate son. However, the last dukedom was created by Queen Victoria and this documentary examines what will happen as they gradually become extinct due to lack of a male heir. Featuring interviews with the Duke of Marlborough and his Aunt Rosemary, the Duke of Atholl, the Duke of Montrose, the Duchess of Rutland and the Duke and Duchess of St Albans.(n)

programme.title: The Renaissance Unchained
programme.desc: Waldemar Januszczak challenges received wisdom about the cultural movement that began in the Late Medieval period. He begins by examining the notion of the Renaissance having fixed origins in Italy, showcasing the ingenuity in both technique and ideas of great artists including Van Eyck, Memling, Van der Weyden, Cranach, Riemenschneider and Durer.(n)

programme.title: Fishing
programme.desc: The start of a new series sees Rob Hughes and Andy Ford chase early season tench and bream. Glen Pointon is on a fly mission and Rob examines how angling is great for your health.(n)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: This documentary examines the short life and extraordinary career of former NFL star Derrick Thomas, who died after a speeding accident in 2000. Part of ESPN's SEC Storied series.(n)

programme.title: MotoGP Catch-up Show
programme.desc: A whirlwind catch-up from the ninth round of the MotoGP Championship at the Grand Prix of Germany, featuring race highlights and analysis.(n)

programme.title: World Sailing
programme.desc: The latest action and news from the world of sailing.(n)

programme.title: America's Cup
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at how Oracle Team USA mounted a dramatic comeback from 8-1 down to remarkably defeat New Zealand 9-8 at the 34th America's Cup in 2013.(n)

programme.title: Motorsport: DTM
programme.desc: Race one from the fourth round of the Deutsche Tourenwagen Masters at the Norisring. Drivers who have competed in this series include Mika Hakkinen and David Coulthard.(n)

programme.desc: Great Britain take on Australia, Czech Republic and the USA in round one of the Speedway World Cup at King's Lynn. GB are hoping to reach their second consecutive final.(n)

programme.title: British Rally Championship Highlights

programme.desc: The best of the action from round two of the MSA British Rallycross Championship at the Lydden Hill Race Circuit.(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.sub-title: No Crossover: The Trial of Allen Iverson.
programme.desc: In 1993, Allen Iverson went bowling in Hampton. What followed ended with the teen in jail and divided a city along racial lines. Part of the acclaimed 30 for 30 series.(n)

programme.title: Toyota AFL Highlights Show
programme.desc: The best of the action from round 15 of the Australian Football League, featuring in-depth analysis and exclusive behind-the-scenes access.(n)

programme.desc: Episode 511. An Austin couple shock the Sharks with the profits they are making from knee-high boot socks; publicists from Santa Monica, Cal., have come up with a stylish clutch that's perfect for carrying smartphones; and a finance expert pitches his idea for customized chocolate bars. Also: a way for kids to personalize their lunch boxes; and an update on a device that prevents objects from falling out of reach between a car's seat and the center console(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 608. Entrepreneurs with military backgrounds have the opportunity to pitch their products. Included: a nonslip-protective glove for CrossFit; an elite canine-training program; a carrying case for men; a bottle opener made from recycled .50 caliber shells(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 618. Everything pitched to the Sharks is made in the U.S. Included: custom recruitment clothing for sororities; simple tools, which are used to open a Thai coconut and extract the meat; and an invention that can transform any pickup into a "Truck-U-V." Also: an update on a teen who runs a designer bow tie company(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 718. Products that are made in the U.S. are pitched to the Sharks. Included: a fire-starting solution; a regional treat from a successful family-owned restaurant in Webster Springs, W.Va.; space-saving exercise equipment that comes with a hefty price tag; and a follow-up on Daymond John's investment in Three Jerks Jerky(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 719. Veteran and military spouse entrepreneurs try to drum up support. Included: a handbag company that uses upcycled materials, but charges $200 or higher for the product; "smart" gloves that can be used on the ski slopes and motorcycles; a personal organization business that promises to keep homes "majorly" decluttered; and two former Army Rangers who promote peace in dangerous places. Also: an update on an Air Force vet who makes canine meal bars invested in by Daymond John during Season 6(n)

programme.desc: Action from the Rally Poland, the eighth round of the season, which was based in Mikolajki - north of Warsaw in the Masurian lake district. The predominantly flat roads were expected to lead to high speeds in a rally that was first established in 1921.(n)

programme.desc: Inspector Helen saves Turner and Hooch, two Dogues de Bordeaux found abandoned in a garden, while colleague Becky sets off to track down a hound who was spotted stranded in a flood relief channel. Cameras also follow Pepper, a dalmatian who is stealing hearts across Merseyside, and Shih-tzu Olive, who was found in pain on a building site.(n)

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Near the historic city of Bath, business partners Rowena and Mike are running a boutique hotel that is on the brink of going under. Operating the property more like a home than a hotel, Rowena's hospitality means the business is running at a huge loss, so Alex Polizzi attempts to teach these hoteliers how to turn a profit from their customers.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother, featuring the latest tasks, games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother's Bit on the Side
programme.desc: Rylan Clark-Neal has the latest developments and invites his studio audience and celebrity guests to discuss how the Big Brother housemates are getting on.(n)

programme.title: Shock Docs
programme.desc: Cameras follow British tanning addicts, including Karl, 33, from Cardiff who has been injecting himself with an unlicensed product, and Hannah, 21, who lives a few miles away and has been using bleach on her skin to remove old fake tan. There's also a profile of Jay, the 33-year-old Mancunian father of two who spends six days a week on his home sunbed. However, can straight-talking Lisa from Newcastle change his mind? Having recovered from skin cancer, she is on a mission to persuade people to give up sunbeds and use fake tan instead.(n)

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: Eamonn & Ruth: How the Other Half Lives
programme.desc: Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford return to explore the extravagant lifestyles of the super-rich, beginning by heading to the largest city in the United Arab Emirates. After experiencing a luxury night under the stars in the desert, they visit the Burj Khalifa - the tallest building in the world - to meet a multimillionaire who calls it home.(n)

programme.title: World's Most Pampered Pets
programme.desc: Documentary looking for the animal with the most lavish lifestyle and revealing why some owners spend as much money on their pets as they do on themselves. American reality TV star Aubrey O'Day takes her pampered pooches for an extreme makeover, including purple highlights for one and a pink Mohican for another, while Louise Harris from Essex auditions Britain's best-looking `diva dogs' for a new fashion line. Also featured are the world's most expensive pet accessories and the sad story of Kalu the chimp - who missed out on an inheritance of £40million when its owner revealed she had lost her entire fortune.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Compilation of highlights from the home improvement series, featuring bedroom and bathroom makeovers by Californian designer Ann Maurice.(n)

programme.title: House Busters
programme.desc: Janet Ellis and her team of new-age practitioners suggest ways in which changes to homes could positively affect the lives of their owners.(n)

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of dedicated volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary.(n)

programme.title: The Mr Men Show
programme.desc: Mr Fussy finds himself all alone at Mr Messy's party, while Mr Bump plays painful games at Miss Whoop's get-together.(n)

programme.title: Mofy
programme.desc: The shy rabbit wants her friends to read the poem she wrote, but they all are tied up with their own tasks.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George blows bubbles and Peppa enjoys popping them.(n)

programme.title: Little Princess
programme.desc: The heroine tries to find the perfect place to pitch a tent.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Ryder and the Paw Patrol team help to rescue a lost kitten, but the feline causes mayhem.(n)

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Team Bob dig the foundations for a new skyscraper in the business zone, but the project comes to a halt when they discover ancient ruins.(n)

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Pontypandy is flooded by a high tide and Norman goes out in a boat to save Woolly and her lamb.(n)

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: Emily is asked to supervise Dash on a trip to the steam fair, but when he runs out of fuel after showing off, she decides to complete the journey without him.(n)

programme.title: Shimmer and Shine
programme.desc: Seta steals a special wishing star after it appears in the night sky over Zahramay Falls. Shimmer and Shine try to get it back before the sorceress makes a wish.(n)

programme.title: Noddy: Toyland Detective
programme.sub-title: Noddy and the Case of the Broken Xylophone Bridge.
programme.desc: Noddy and Big Ears find that someone has broken a key on the xylophone bridge, and try to fix it with sticky tape.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Mayor Goodway accidentally takes off in a hot-air balloon, so Ryder and the Paw Patrol must make a dramatic rescue in a bid to save her and win the race.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Holly breaks her wand and goes to the factory at the bottom of the Great Elf Tree to get it fixed.(n)

programme.title: Digby Dragon
programme.desc: When Chips catches a shell in his fishing net, he's certain he's actually found a Sea Nut. He's determined to keep it - until the shell starts travelling around by itself.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George and Peppa help Grandpa Pig make a scarecrow.(n)

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: Wissper summons Herbert the shire horse and Monty the meerkat to help teach the penguins to take turns on the new ice-slide.(n)

programme.title: Wanda and the Alien
programme.desc: The duo find a duck egg, and when the duckling hatches it begins to honk instead of quacking.(n)

programme.title: The Wright Stuff
programme.desc: Matthew Wright and his guests talk about the issues of the day, with viewers calling in to offer their opinions.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Tracy Metro tries to help couple Rob and Nikaila in Jarrow, who have already tried to jazz up their house, but now need to take things to the next level.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother, featuring the latest tasks, games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Justin, Scarlett and Mason search frantically for Brody, while Marilyn is frustrated that John seems to be avoiding her. Roo comes to a decision about the daughter she gave away.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Leo begs David to get painkillers for Mannix from the hospital, leading to a fall-out between the pair. Paige is unsettled by Elly's interest in Mark, while Xanthe hits rock-bottom.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team goes in search of a stolen radiotherapy canister that could have been used to make a bomb after a man impersonating a Navy Seal dies after being set on fire. Meanwhile, team leader Hetty Lange has been acting strangely and Callen offers to help with whatever is troubling her. Guest starring Claire Forlani (Camelot), with Chris O'Donnell and Linda Hunt.(n)

programme.title: In the Dark
programme.desc: A woman is blinded following an accident in which her husband and child are killed. She employs a nurse as a carer, only to discover he has developed a dangerous obsession with her, which turns violent as she begins to regain her independence. Thriller, starring Elisabeth Rohm, Sam Page and Shannon Elizabeth. Edited for daytime broadcast.(n)

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Leo begs David to get painkillers for Mannix from the hospital, leading to a fall-out between the pair. Paige is unsettled by Elly's interest in Mark, while Xanthe hits rock-bottom.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Justin, Scarlett and Mason search frantically for Brody, while Marilyn is frustrated that John seems to be avoiding her. Roo comes to a decision about the daughter she gave away.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the evening's headlines, including coverage of the latest national and international stories.(n)

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.sub-title: GPs Behind Closed Doors: Best of Patient Files.
programme.desc: A patient offers an insight into his ongoing battle with alcoholism, which has led to divorce, personal injury and mental health problems. Elsewhere, a young woman who became paralysed from the chest down after an accident shares her story, and a married couple with learning difficulties discuss how they are there to support each other. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Highland Midwife
programme.desc: New series. Documentary series taking viewers to the unforgiving surrounds of the Scottish Highlands, following three expectant mothers and the professionals who attend them. In the opening episode, first-time mum Bridie's hopes for a local birth are threatened when her labour fails to progress, while the sudden arrival of Anastasia's baby necessitates a late-night dash for midwife Morven.(n)

programme.title: Where There's Blame, There's a Claim
programme.desc: A woman who won a huge pay-out from her dentist after a number of botched dental jobs, but is still waiting to receive the money from her claim, despite bailiffs' attempts to recover it. Plus, a young woman who was hit by a falling concrete slab and paralysed from the waist down hopes to settle a seven-figure compensation claim.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother, featuring the latest tasks, games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother's Bit on the Side
programme.desc: Rylan Clark-Neal presents the live Big Brother companion show, including a debate on the burning issues and celebrity guests' thoughts on the latest developments.(n)

programme.title: Dark Water
programme.desc: Dahlia and daughter Ceci are happy in their New York apartment until stagnant water begins to seep through the roof. Is someone - or something - living upstairs? Psychological horror from the author of The Ring(n)

programme.title: Carlito's Way
programme.desc: A Puerto-Rican ex-con, just released from prison, pledges to stay away from drugs and violence despite the pressure around him and lead on to a better life outside of NYC(n)

programme.title: Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Kevin Costner stars in this epic western biopic chronicling the life of legendary lawman Wyatt Earp, from Dodge City to the shootout at the OK Corral(n)

programme.title: Scent of a Woman
programme.desc: A blind ex-army man, Lt. Colonel Frank Slade meets up with a young student and they both head off to New York for a weekend that will change their lives..(n)

programme.title: Diner
programme.desc: Barry Levinson's masterly tribute to his youthful years in Baltimore is an early showcase for future stars; Kevin Bacon, Mickey Rourke and Ellen Barkin(n)

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: New York cop John McClane fights terrorists in an Los Angeles skyscraper in a bid to rescue his estranged wife, who happens to be one of the hostages(n)

programme.title: Dumb and Dumber
programme.desc: Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels star as Lloyd and Harry, two friends who must overcome their complete stupidity, and the attentions of smarter criminals, to return a bag of cash to its rightful owner(n)

programme.title: National Treasure
programme.desc: A modern-day fortune hunter races to find an ancient treasure hidden by the Founding Fathers(n)

programme.title: High Anxiety
programme.desc: A renowned Harvard psychiatrist (with a concealed fear of heights) takes over as director of the PsychoNeurotic Institute for the Very, Very Nervous after the last administrator dies under suspicious circumstances(n)

programme.title: To Be or Not to Be
programme.desc: A Polish theatre troupe get caught up in the Nazi invasion and try to run rings around the occupying forces(n)

programme.title: Baby Mama
programme.desc: Successful and single businesswoman Kate Holbrook is finally determined to have a kid on her own now that she is 37. But when she discovers that she has only a million-to-one chance of getting pregnant, the driven Kate finds in working girl Angie Ostrowiski an unlikely surrogate. Everything is apparently going well. That until Angie shows up at Kate doorstep with no place to live. The two opposites try to get along and, in the middle of their tug-of-war, they discover that there can be a different kind of family(n)

programme.title: By the Sea
programme.desc: In 1970s France, a former dancer (Angelina Jolie-Pitt) and her writer husband (Brad Pitt) attempt to rebuild their crumbling marriage by taking an extended vacation to a small coastal town, where they bond with its quirky inhabitants. As he struggles with writer's block and she with her emotional turmoil stemming from their troubled relationship, they try to remember what brought them together fourteen years prior. This film marks the first time in ten years that Angelina Jolie-Pitt and Brad Pitt have starred together, since the 2005 film Mr. and Mrs. Smith. Jolie-Pitt is also the writer and director of the film(n)

programme.title: Hereafter
programme.desc: Three people dealing with their own experience of the afterlife find their lives intertwining(n)

programme.title: Never Die Alone
programme.desc: Rapper-turned-actor DMX is chilling in this intense account of the life and death of a violent drug kingpin. Flashbacks chronicle the life of King David (DMX), who turns out to be more like Goliath when he is knifed by a gangster's young henchman (Michael Ealy). David Arquette costars as an aspiring writer, who inherits audiotapes that detail all of King David's nasty business dealings. Clifton Powell(n)

programme.title: The Conspirator
programme.desc: Lawyer Frederick Aiken defends Mary Surratt from charges of participating in the assassination of Abraham Lincoln, and realises that she's being used as bait to capture her son, the only conspirator to have eluded justice(n)

programme.title: In America
programme.desc: From master storyteller Jim Sheridan comes a deeply personal and emotionally raw tale of a family finding its soul In America. Through the wide-open eyes of two young heroines, Sheridan transforms a devastating human tragedy into a riveting, humor-tinged story about memory, secrets, love, loss, coming together, and starting over(n)

programme.title: Ghost World
programme.desc: Two highschool friends,Enid and Rebecca, on the verge of leaving their adolescence behind, try to decide what to do with their lives.Enid discovers a kindred spirit in fellow misfit Seymour, who shares her disgust with the world around them(n)

programme.title: Dallas Buyers Club
programme.desc: Matthew McConaughey headlines director Jean-Marc Vallée's biographical drama centering on the story of Ron Woodroof, a Texas electrician who was diagnosed as HIV-positive in 1986, and who subsequently devoted his life to providing fellow HIV patients with non-FDA-approved drugs and supplements during an era when doctors were still struggling to understand the devastating disease. Defying his surprise death sentence, Woodroof set out to procure any and all non-toxic alternative HIV treatments available, and established a "buyers club" to provide the treatments to others afflicted with the disease. But that mission quickly made him a target for both the U.S. medical establishment and the pharmaceutical industry, both of which resented his defiance of government sanctions, and joined forces to shut down his operation by any means necessary(n)

programme.title: Michael Clayton
programme.desc: A burned-out "fixer" at a powerful corporate law firm in New York City who faces a crisis of conscience(n)

programme.title: Deepwater Horizon
programme.desc: Riveting docudrama about the Deepwater Horizon disaster, the 2010 oil-rig explosion that resulted in the largest offshore oil spill in U.S. history. The film depicts the challenges that the rig's crew faced as they fought for survival(n)

programme.title: The Road Warrior
programme.desc: "Mad Max" sequel about survival in a post-apocalyptic wasteland(n)

programme.title: Spider-Man
programme.desc: Adaptation of the Marvel Comics adventures of Peter Parker, a nerdy high-school student who is transformed into a web-spinning vigilante(n)

programme.title: Gods of Egypt
programme.desc: A thief enlists the help of mythical Egyptian gods to overthrow a vicious ruler(n)

programme.title: In the Heart of the Sea
programme.desc: In the winter of 1820, the crew of the New England whaling ship Essex struggle for their survival after an attack by a rogue sperm whale leaves them stranded at sea for 90 days(n)

programme.title: Morgan
programme.desc: A corporate consultant (Kate Mara) must determine the fate of a mysterious artificial being called Morgan (Anya Taylor-Joy), which has begun evolving at a faster rate than anticipated. When Morgan attacks one of her creators, the group surrounding her are pressed to make a decision. Luke Scott directed this sci-fi thriller, which co-stars Rose Leslie and Paul Giamatti(n)

programme.title: The Forest
programme.desc: Set in the Aokigahara Forest, which is a place where people commit suicides, a young American woman, Sara, is in search of her twin sister, who has mysteriously disappeared in the forest. Despite the warnings from the villagers, Sara travels into the ghost-filled forest to save her sister to discover the truth while being confronted by angry and tormented souls of the dead that prey on anyone who crosses their paths(n)

programme.desc: Old Ladies and Satan. Sketches include two women battling Satan; a man shopping for mattresses; and nightclub patrons confronting the truth about themselves(n)

programme.desc: The world's first portable power cleaner that lets you clean any time, anywhere(n)

programme.desc: Fat Butt and Pancake Head. Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck come to town(n)

programme.title: American Justice
programme.sub-title: Body of Evidence: The Tom Capano Trial
programme.desc: Body of Evidence: The Tom Capano Trial. A&E investigates the deadly consequences of unrequited love in the one-hour American Justice: Body of Evidence -- The Tom Capano Trial. Wealthy and well-connected, Tom Capano was still subjected to the torments of the heart. When an affair with Anne Marie Fahey ended badly, he snapped. After murdering his ex-lover, Capano dumped her body in the water, a seemingly clever move. However, Capano never counted on the guilty conscience of his own brother to secure his undoing. The police kept the jealous boyfriend under surveillance until they had the sibling's confession as accomplice. Surprisingly, at trial, Capano himself admitted to removing the body. But, he held onto the claim that Fahey was killed by someone else. Capano was convicted and sentenced to death(n)

Jo discovers the suspect works as a security guard in the same building as the woman, and investigates the theory he has been stalking her, but extracting a confession puts her in a tricky position. At the end of an arduous shift, she discovers her hard work is to be rewarded with promotion to sergeant. Guest starring Kara Tointon, Barry Sloane and Gareth David-Lloyd.(n)

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: On her first shift as a sergeant, Jo is called to the scene of an aggravated robbery in which the homeowner died in a particularly violent and bloody way. When it emerges the victim was an abusive drunk and had been involved with another woman, Grace warms to the man's Asian-born widow and clashes with Max over his apparent racial prejudice. Gabrielle Glaister guest stars.(n)
