programme.desc: Dan Savage; Richard A. Clarke; Dan Abrams; Katty Kay; Michael Steele. Advice columnist Dan Savage; counter-terrorism expert Richard A. Clarke. The roundtable guests are legal analyst Dan Abrams, news anchor Katty Kay and political analyst Michael Steele(n)

programme.title: Loving
programme.desc: Enthralling biopic about Virginian interracial couple Richard and Mildred Loving, whose arrest in 1958 for violating the state's miscegenation laws eventually led to a landmark Supreme Court decision(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: 07-02-2017. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Slumdog Millionaire
programme.desc: (2008) Danny Boyle's eight Oscar- and seven BAFTA-winning blockbuster opens as Jamal Malik (Dev Patel), a chaiwalah at a call centre, is on the verge of winning 20 million rupees on Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? . But the host of the show, Prem Kumar (Anil Kapoor) is convinced he's cheating and hands him over to the police to beat the truth out of him. Jamal reveals that the right answer to each question has come from a significant part of his life, from when he and his brother Salim were orphaned after their mother was killed in religious violence. As he continues his story, Jamal reveals how he knows each answer; how he fell in love with Latika, an orphaned girl from whom he was later separated; and how his brother Salim took the path of violence as a gangster's gunman. But as Jamal is returned to the studio for the last question, Salim finally repays his brother's trust. As well as the outstanding Patel, Jamal is played in different stages of his life by Tanay Hemant Gharu and Ayush Mahesh Khedekar; Salim is played by Madhur Mittal, Ashutosh Lobo Gajiwala and Azharuddin Mohammed Ismail; Latika is played by Frieda Pinto, Tanvi Ganesh Lonkar and Rubina Ali, all of whom turn in stunning performances. English/ Hindi with English subtitles(n)

programme.title: War Dogs
programme.desc: Two down-on-their-luck pals become arms dealers, but get in over their heads when they land a $300 million contract with the U.S. government to supply weaponry to forces in Afghanistan. This raucous comedy-drama is based on true events(n)

programme.title: Bend It like Beckham
programme.desc: The comic tale of a young Asian woman who joins the local semi-professional football team but opts not to tell her traditionalist family, who want her to go to law school and settle down with a nice Indian boy. She finds it increasingly difficult to deal with her double life as a dutiful daughter and a talented footballer(n)

programme.title: Jonas Brothers: The Concert Experience
programme.desc: A 3-D concert film of the 2008 Jonas Brothers Burning Up concert tour, as well as documentary footage on the lives of the three brothers(n)

programme.title: Shakespeare in Love
programme.desc: Tom Stoppard provided the witty and intelligent script for John Madden's romantic comedy in which young Will Shakespeare struggles with writer's block and money worries while trying to complete Romeo and Ethel: The Pirate's Daughter. Gwyneth Paltrow once more employs her faultless English accent, playing aristocratic Viola de Lesseps, who is shortly to be married off but yearns to slum it as an actor. Disguising herself as a boy in order to be allowed on stage, Viola becomes Will's muse, and the more familiar tale of Romeo and Juliet begins to take shape as the couple fall passionately in love. The film is littered with knowing lines and energetically supported by a stellar cast, including Judy Dench as Queen Elizabeth - a cameo performance which earned her one of the movie's seven Oscars(n)

programme.title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
programme.desc: (2005) Enchanting children's fantasy, based on the classic novel by CS Lewis. When young World War Two evacuee Lucy Pevensie hides in an old wardrobe during a game of hide and seek, she finds herself transported to the magical land of Narnia, locked in eternal winter by the evil White Witch. Her siblings do not believe her when she tells them of this strange new world, but they are soon in Narnia themselves, fighting alongside the noble lion Aslan to defeat the witch and her mighty army.Dir: Andrew Adamson. (T) (Digital Dolby 5.1)(n)

programme.title: Crossroads
programme.desc: Four years after they left school, three old pals team up for a road trip from Georgia to California. Mimi's got dreams of Hollywood, Kit's looking forward to seeing her beau, but Lucy wants escape...and maybe to find the mother she's never met(n)

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: In the future, criminals are arrested before they have even committed their crime, thanks to the forecasting of 'pre-cogs'. Detective John Anderton thinks the system is perfect... until he's arrested. Brilliant sci-fi thriller based on a story by Philip K Dick(n)

programme.title: Term Life
programme.desc: A thief takes his estranged daughter on the lam when a job goes awry in this intense thriller. As crooks and corrupt cops close in on them, he also takes out a life-insurance policy on himself in an effort to leave something behind for his daughter(n)

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: 06/20/2017. Segments include a look at the dwindling popularity of bullfighting in Spain; profiles of American tennis up-and-comer Frances Tiafoe and Paralympian and Mount Everest climber Jeff Glasbrenner; a visit with a young man working to chronicle and assist surviving Negro League players(n)

programme.title: Unfaithful
programme.desc: One windy day in New York, Connie Sumner literally bumps into Paul Martel. She's happily married with a child, he's a dealer in rare books. When invited to his flat to repair the damage caused by their sidewalk collision, he makes a move on her, but she declines and leaves. However, she's now intrigued by him and it's not long before she returns to him and embarks on a passionate affair. But Connie's not the best liar in the world, and her businessman husband Ed, thinking her story doesn't stack up, hires a private investigator to keep tabs on her. When the detective's evidence confirms Ed's fears, it thrusts the three main players on the road to tragedy..(n)

programme.desc: The Lord of Darkness wants to retire but none of his three sons seems good enough for the job. When he decides he will not cede his throne to any of them, the two most powerful ones escape to Earth to create a kingdom for themselves. This action closes the portal filtering sinful souls to Hell and causes Satan to begin withering away. Now it's up to the weak but beloved Nicky to save his dad and the humankind before one of his brothers becomes the new Satan(n)

programme.title: The Good Guy
programme.desc: After executive producing the acclaimed documentary Manda Bala and the J.M. Coetzee adaptation Disgrace, Julio DePietro makes his feature debut as a writer-director with The Good Guy, a drama about ambitious young Wall Streeters fighting each other -- and sometimes their own decent nature -- to get ahead in the world. Our narrator, Tommy (Scott Porter of TV's Friday Night Lights), is young, clever, charming, and attractive. He's got a smart, pretty girlfriend, Beth (Alexis Bledel of Gilmore Girls), an urban conservationist. He's also very good at his investment broker job, impressing his ruthless, cynical boss, Cash (erstwhile "Brat Pack" member Andrew McCarthy). When a key member of Tommy's sales team suddenly leaves for a competitor, Tommy needs to fill his spot quickly, and takes a chance on the bumbling Daniel (Bryan Greenberg, Bride Wars), a former Marine and computer geek who seems a bit naïve about high finance and a bit nervous around women. Tommy takes Daniel under his wing, showing him how to dress, where to socialize, and how to charm attractive women. Their relationship is threatened when Daniel begins spending more time with Beth, joining her book club, and becoming her confidant. Tommy begins to question his decision to share his wisdom with Daniel, while Daniel is forced to decide what success really means to him, and where his loyalties lie. The Good Guy also stars Anna Chlumsky (In the Loop) and Aaron Yoo (Disturbia). The film had its world premiere at the 2009 Tribeca Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Broadcast News
programme.desc: Tom Grunick is the slow-thinking, good-looking TV anchorman competing alongside reporter Aaron Altman for the heart of sharp cookie producer Jane Craig(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie'
programme.desc: A look at "Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie," a 2016 adaptation of the popular British sitcom about hard-living ladies Edina and Patsy, who flee to the French Riviera after they accidentally cause the death of a celebrity at a posh party. The film stars Jennifer Saunders and Joanna Lumley, and is directed by Mandie Fletcher(n)

programme.title: Ernest Scared Stupid
programme.desc: Ernest gets into deep trouble when he decides to build a treehouse for the neighborhood kid and accidentally digs up an ugly, evil-tempered troll who hates all children and shows it by promptly turning the five kids helping Ernest into wooden sculptures(n)

programme.title: Hollywood Ending
programme.desc: A down-on-his luck auteur gets one more chance at the big time -- provided his neuroses don't swallow him whole -- in Woody Allen's 33rd feature release, Hollywood Ending. Allen plays Val Waxman, a one-time cinematic genius who's resorted to taking advertisement work to pay the bills for himself and his airhead live-in girlfriend, Lori (Debra Messing). Val finds his luck is about to change, however, when he receives the script for The City Never Sleeps, a period noir set against the backdrop of 1940s New York City. It seems his ex-wife, Ellie (Tea Leoni), now an executive at Galaxy Pictures, has been pulling for him to direct the picture, claiming he's the only man who can do justice to the script. She even manages to convince her boyfriend, Hal (Treat Williams), Galaxy's high-powered studio head, to take a chance on Val's "unique vision." Just when the cameras are ready to roll, however, Val finds that unique vision in jeopardy -- literally -- as he's struck with a psychosomatic case of blindness. When physicians and psychiatrists fail to cure him, Val contrives a scheme to forge ahead with the picture, for fear of blowing his one last chance at greatness. Hollywood Ending co-stars George Hamilton and Mark Rydell(n)

programme.title: One Night Stand

programme.title: The Witches of Eastwick
programme.desc: On Thursday nights three female friends -- Alex, Sukie, and Jane -- meet to chug martinis, learn Chinese aphrodisiac cooking and lament the scarcity of eligible men. As they sit around, they fantasize about and describe their idea of the ideal male. Arriving in town the following day is Satan, disguised as mysterious stranger Darrell Van Horn. One by one, Van Horne seduces each of the women. Then, strange things begin to happen(n)

Years later, as both are ready to marry different partners, destiny does indeed seem to conspire to rekindle their love(n)

programme.desc: Adapted from author Lois Duncan's 1971 children's book of the same name, director Thor Freudenthal's Hotel for Dogs follows two mischievous orphans as they attempt to hide dozens of stray dogs in an abandoned hotel. Disheartened by their new guardians' announcement that pets are strictly forbidden, 16-year-old Andi (Emma Roberts) and her younger brother, Bruce (Jake T. Austin), race to find a home for their loyal dog Friday. Fortunately for Friday, there's an abandoned hotel just around the corner, and Bruce possesses just the kind of mechanical smarts needed to transform the rundown inn into a four-star retreat for canines. For a while, Friday and his friends have it made, but when the neighbors start to get suspicious, Andi and Bruce resort to every trick in the book in order to prevent their secret from being discovered. programme.title: Next Day Air
programme.desc: An overnight shipment of drugs winds up being sent to the wrong recipient, prompting a frantic race to recover the package before the contents are discovered in this fast-paced crime comedy starring Donald Faison, Mos Def, and Mike Epps. When Brody (Epps) and Guch (Wood Harris) received package containing 10 kilos of grade-A cocaine, they assumed their financial woes were a thing of the past. The package was intended for their Brody and Guch's next-door neighbors, but the whacked-out courier (Donald Faison) delivered it to the wrong address. Recognizing the possibility for profit, the scheming duo plans to sell the cocaine to Brody's drug-dealing cousin (Omari Hardwick). Meanwhile Jesus (Cisco Reyes) and his girlfriend Chita (Yasmin Deliz), the intended recipients of the cocaine, set out to procure the package before notorious drug lord Bodego Diablo (Emilio Rivera) realizes it's gone missing. But Bodega is no slouch; he already knows the shipment was botched, and he's determined to get his drugs back no matter what the cost. Later, as Brody and Guch prepare to seal the deal that will set them up for life, the guns are drawn and the chaos begins(n)

programme.title: New Best Friend
programme.desc: Three rich, pretty people befriend their poor, mousy classmate and live to regret it in this teen-centric thriller. Alicia (Mia Kirshner), Hadley (Meredith Monroe), Julianne (Rachel True), and Sydney (Dominique Swain) are four students enrolled in the same sociology class at Colby University, an exclusive and respected college in the Carolinas. Alicia is a local girl born into modest circumstances who struggles to make ends meet and rarely gets a second look from the male students on campus, while Hadley, Julianne, and Sydney are close friends who all come from wealthy families and seem more concerned with partying than their studies. Alicia and Hadley are paired up to work on their semester project for the class, which is to be centered around the theme "Lead, Follow, or Get Out of the Way." As part of the project, Hadley decides to befriend Alicia, and brings her into her social circle. At first, Alicia seems more than grateful for the attention of her new friends, and blooms under the influence of Hadley, Julianne, and Sydney. But it isn't long before Alicia's personality begins to shift; she develops a powerful appetite for drugs and alcohol, and soon begins taking advantage of her new friendships. Things come to a head when Alicia seduces Sydney's boyfriend, Josh (Oliver Hudson), and soon Alicia ends up in the hospital after OD'ing on drugs. Artie Bonner (Taye Diggs), a local sheriff, begins looking into Alicia's case, convinced that her near-fatal accident with drugs was no accident at all(n)

programme.title: Insomnia

programme.title: Rendition
programme.desc: Gavin Hood's thriller stars Reese Witherspoon as Isabella Fields El-Ibrahimi, the wife of American-Egyptian chemical engineer Anwar El-Ibrahimi. When Anwar disappears on his way home from a conference in South Africa, she is driven frantic trying to find proof of his whereabouts in the face of official denial. But he is being held as a suspected terrorist in secrecy in Marrakech, where CIA operative Douglas Freeman is reluctantly involved in his torture. Meanwhile, one of the torturer's daughters, Fatima, is secretly in love with a fellow student who may be following extreme paths. As Hood brings the strands together, the various characters' actions intertwine, moving towards a dramatic conclusion(n)

programme.desc: This Boy's Life is a true-life coming-of-age story about '50s teenager Tobias Wolff (Leonardo DiCaprio) and his mother, Caroline (Ellen Barkin). After travelling around the country in an effort to avoid Caroline's abusive boyfriend, the mother and son settle in Washington state, where she marries a man named Dwight Hansen (Robert DeNiro), who appears to be a good husband and father. However, Dwight reveals himself as an abusive man shortly after the marriage; in particular, he verbally harasses and physically beats the young Tobias. By the end of the film, Tobias has to confront his stepfather. This Boy's Life is based on the autobiographical book of the same name by the real Tobias Wolff(n)

programme.title: Le Divorce
programme.desc: Based on the 1997 National Book Award-nominated novel of the same name by Diane Johnson (co-writer of the script for Stanley Kubrick's The Shining), Le Divorce is a romantic comedy from director James Ivory. Revisiting the "Americans in France" theme that Ivory explored in 1998's A Soldier's Daughter Never Cries, the film stars Kate Hudson as Isabel Walker. When she receives word that her pregnant poetess sister Roxy (Naomi Watts) has been left by her philandering French husband, artist Charles-Henri de Persand (Melvil Poupaud), Isabel offers her help and moral support. As the depressive Roxy struggles with the separation proceedings -- which include the rights to ownership of a work of art that's a family heirloom -- Isabel takes a job with author Olivia Pace and has a fling with the bohemian Yves (Romain Duris). But things get complicated when the younger, more impudent sister decides instead to pursue Charles' uncle, the snooty, married diplomat Edgar (Thierry Lhermitte), and when a mysterious man (Matthew Modine) starts stalking Roxy. Eventually, the rest of the plucky Walker clan has to come to the aid of the siblings. Stockard Channing and Sam Waterston co-star(n)

programme.desc: The engrossing History Channel documentary Last Stand of the 300: The Legendary Battle at Thermopylae offers an unofficial counterpoint to the Hollywood blockbuster 300, starring Gerard Butler and Lena Headey. This documentary, like the feature, explores the legendary events that transpired in the year 480 B.C., when a legion of Greek city-states took on the forces of the Persian Empire at the pass of Thermopylae, defending itself successfully despite an overwhelming disadvantage in terms of battalion size. This nonfiction work recounts the tactical strategies that accounted for the Greeks' lengthy holdout, and utilizes both digital animation and dramatic reenactments to relay the thrilling story(n)

programme.desc: A Predator battles an infestation of aliens after a spaceship crashes near a small Colorado town in this gory sequel(n)

programme.title: Pet Sematary
programme.desc: Upon moving to a quiet new neighbourhood, the Creed family lose their cat in a road accident. Feeling bad for them, a neighbour tells Mr Creed of an ancient Indian burial ground believed to have powers of resurrection. However, when the Creed's infant son meets a fate similar to the family pet, Mr Creed can't resist temptation and, in his zeal, unleashes an unspeakable evil from beyond the grave. Director Mary Lambert's second film is a faithful rendering of the Stephen King bestseller(n)

programme.title: Pet Sematary II
programme.desc: A liberal dose of humour is lumped in with the horror in this sequel to the 1989 hit based on Stephen King's novel. Edward Furlong is Geoff, the new kid in a small Maine town, whose veterinarian father has relocated after the death of his wife. After a friend's dog is killed, Geoff and the boy discover and make use of a 'sematary' with the power to reanimate the dead..(n)

programme.title: Pet Sematary
programme.desc: Upon moving to a quiet new neighbourhood, the Creed family lose their cat in a road accident. Feeling bad for them, a neighbour tells Mr Creed of an ancient Indian burial ground believed to have powers of resurrection. However, when the Creed's infant son meets a fate similar to the family pet, Mr Creed can't resist temptation and, in his zeal, unleashes an unspeakable evil from beyond the grave. Director Mary Lambert's second film is a faithful rendering of the Stephen King bestseller(n)

programme.title: Shutter Island
programme.desc: Martin Scorsese and Leonardo DiCaprio team up for a fourth time for this adaptation of Shutter Island, a novel by Dennis Lehane (Mystic River). The film opens in 1954 as World War II veteran and current federal marshal Teddy Daniels (Leonardo DiCaprio) and his new partner, Chuck (Mark Ruffalo), ferry to Shutter Island, a water-bound mental hospital housing the criminally insane. They have been asked to investigate the disappearance of Rachel Solando (Emily Mortimer), a patient admitted to the asylum after she murdered her three children. As Teddy quizzes Dr. Cawley (Ben Kingsley), the head of the institution, he begins to suspect that the authorities in charge might not be giving him the whole truth, and that a terrible fate may befall all the patients in the spooky Ward C -- a unit devoted to the most heinous of the hospital's inmates. Complicating matters further, Teddy has a secret of his own -- the arsonist who murdered his wife is incarcerated on Shutter Island. Driven to confront his wife's killer, and stranded on the island because of a hurricane, Teddy must unravel the secrets of the eerie place before succumbing to his own madness. Max von Sydow, Emily Mortimer, Michelle Williams, Patricia Clarkson, and Jackie Earle Haley round out the supporting cast(n)

programme.title: House of Wax
programme.desc: Six college students end up in an eerie town that is not marked on any map when their car breaks down on a road trip. They are intrigued by the local House of Wax, with its detailed and realistic-looking figures. But there is a reason why they look so real, and the group soon realizes they need to find their way out before they fall prey to the evil that is behind those perfectly carved sculptures. The cast in this horror pic includes young actors Elisha Cuthbert, Jared Padalecki and Chad Michael Murray of TV fame, and an infamous cinematic turn by Paris Hilton(n)

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Midge Ure talks about headlining the 80s Rewind festival this summer and the legacy of benefit concerts following the massive Live Aid event he masterminded with Bob Geldof. Presented by Susanna Reid, Piers Morgan, Charlotte Hawkins and Sean Fletcher.(n)

Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Farmer Alex Preston is found dead at the sacred Crowcall stone circle in Midsomer Mow. Suspicion initially falls on local druids led by high priests Ezra Canning and Leticia Clifford, since Preston's plans to plough Gorse Meadow would have barred their access to the site. Barnaby and Jones are joined by new pathologist Kate Wilding to investigate, and as the case wears on, the inspector becomes convinced greed rather than spiritualism is the motive. Starring Neil Dudgeon, Jason Hughes and Tamzin Malleson.(n)

programme.title: Davina McCall: Life at the Extreme
programme.desc: The TV presenter examines how animals survive in hostile environments by visiting some of the hottest, coldest, deepest and wettest places on Earth to experience life in extreme conditions. She begins in the deserts of Namibia in south-west Africa, and discovers it home to an incredibly diverse range of life despite the high temperatures and lack of water. Davina goes head-to-head in a running race against a cheetah, camps in the sand dunes overnight and stays with San bushpeople to learn the skills that they have developed to survive.(n)

Having lived in Salford all of their lives, the twins recently moved into their new bungalow for health reasons and have never wavered in devoting their lives to helping others, so Alan and his team work to transform their concrete patch of dismal cracked pavers and hard edges into a beautiful cottage-style outdoor space where they can relax.(n)

programme.desc: New series. Joanna Lumley travels back to the country of her birth, travelling the length and breadth of India to explore its diverse landscapes and cultural traditions. programme.desc: Part one of two. His first stop is a sanctuary south of Delhi, where he meets Lakshmi, an obese elephant.(n)

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.desc: The host invites actor Nigel Havers to look back on a 50-year career as one of Britain's best-loved actors on stage and screen. The star of Coronation Street, The Charmer and Chariots of Fire speaks candidly about being caught in an emotional tug of war between his wife and his lover, and how it led him to contemplate taking his own life. He talks about his most famous fan, Princess Diana, his stint as a nude model and how his dashing good looks, charisma and cut-glass accent have helped him to be a success with women both on and off screen.(n)

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: As the anniversary of Sarah's death approaches, Du Plessis helps Olivia remember her mother by taking her on a trip into the Bush. However, when he ignores the symptoms of his worsening heart condition, it leads to disaster. Meanwhile, Danny is relieved to be back at work, but gets more than he bargained for as he and Alice deal with two rogue lions that are preying on local cattle. Drama, starring Deon Stewardson, Olivia Scott-Taylor, Stephen Tompkinson and Dawn Steele.(n)

programme.title: Man About the House
programme.desc: Robin regrets sampling Mr Roper's home brew when he is breathalysed during a driving lesson with Chrissy. Comedy series, with Richard O'Sullivan.(n)

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: New tenant Osborne seemingly dies after eating a bowl of Miss Jones' home-made soup, plunging the household into mourning - but Rigsby is the one who ends up being measured for a coffin. Classic comedy, starring Leonard Rossiter.(n)

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: The couple offer their services to a woman in labour, despite their lack of experience - though George does know how to dismantle a motorbike. Comedy, starring Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Vernon buys a batch of topsoil for his new compost-producing business, little suspecting it is from a contaminated landfill site. The shady dealer who sold him the soil winds up dead - as do a number of local cows - and Vernon is soon fighting for his life. Elsewhere, seductive sergeant Nokes sets her sights on Steve Crane, and Bellamy wonders whether Gina will return to Aidensfield and marry him. Geoffrey Hughes, James Carlton and Mark Jordon star.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: A scientist hits on the cunning idea of faking his own death, but is later murdered for real - leaving Jessica to prove the innocence of the police's chief suspect. Shannon Tweed guest stars, with Angela Lansbury, Bradford Dillman and Bruce Weitz.(n)

programme.title: The Booze Cruise 2: The Treasure Hunt
programme.desc: Sequel to the 2003 one-off comedy drama, in which Dave, Rob and Maurice embark on a two-day charity treasure hunt. They're joined by Dave's wife Cath, keen to make sure her husband sticks to his diet, Daniel, who's back from France and worrying he may not be the father of his pregnant wife's baby, and Marcus Forster, a potential client of Dave, who's not exactly the most pleasant fellow they've ever met. The only trouble is, everyone has to be nice to him if Dave's going to bag a new contract.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: While investigating the fatal stabbing of a psychiatrist with a caseload of violent adolescent patients, Ronnie and Joe's first instinct is to question those he was treating. However, the case takes a disturbing turn when the detectives discover a hidden sleeping compartment in the victim's office which has clearly been used recently by one of his underage visitors - and evidence comes to light suggesting he may have been having an affair with one of them. Drama, starring Bradley Walsh and Ben Bailey Smith, with Ramon Tikaram and Hattie Morahan.(n)

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: An aristocrat goes missing, along with his collection of explicit erotic paintings - and Morse's investigation provides him with a close-up view of the upper crust's dark side. What is more, there is a further culture shock lying in wait - the prospect of working with a new female pathologist. Starring John Thaw, Kevin Whately, Amanda Hillwood, Patricia Hodge and Clifford Rose.(n)

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: A murder victim is found in unusual circumstances, buried with a cache of 100-year-old timber. A likely suspect is soon identified, only to be shot dead by a mystery assassin - a development that has repercussions for DI Lane's love life. Jack Shepherd stars as the dour Cornish copper, with Helen Masters.(n)

programme.desc: Text-based information service.(n)

Grateful of any excuse for a party, the residents are soon letting their hair down to the sound of a salsa beat.(n)

programme.title: Road to Avonlea
programme.desc: Rachel Lynde is the victim of a sudden stroke and is sent out West to recover with her son. Starring Sarah Polley.(n)

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team head for rural Cornwall, where they create a spectacular contemporary garden for Chris Finney, a former serviceman who was awarded the George Cross in 2003. A space age-inspired area - complete with solar dome - will test Chris's knowledge as a novice gardener, and provide a stimulating haven for his young family.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Bellamy chases joyriders tearing through Aidensfield and accidentally runs down Don Dibley's son during the pursuit. The boy's father demands compensation, but soon realises his problems have just begun as his daughter reveals she is pregnant. Steve finds himself in trouble and David invents a novel way to rid the estate of moles. Rural drama, starring Mark Jordon, James Carlton and Ted Robbins.(n)

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Matron is forced to change her plans after a tragic turn of events and decides to withdraw her resignation. Nurse Taylor grows closer to Jeff as they tackle an unusual medical emergency, but later finds herself confronted by an angry Frankie. Harper's money-saving schemes backfire in spectacular fashion, while an argument over a patient's health sparks off a chain of events which leaves Gordon's life hanging in the balance. Medical drama starring Wendy Craig, Amy Robbins, Robert Daws and Zoie Kennedy.(n)

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: When Du Plessis learns of Caroline's idea to buy them a retirement home he confesses to Olivia that he gave all their savings to his son. Out of desperation, he pawns a collection of old jewellery to raise some cash, but only succeeds in making the situation worse. Meanwhile, Danny surprises Alice by proposing to her, with Olivia's blessing. Drama, starring Deon Stewardson, Hayley Mills, Olivia Scott-Taylor, Stephen Tompkinson and Dawn Steele.(n)

programme.title: Man About the House
programme.desc: The trio move out to allow workmen into the flat, and Robin is more than happy to share a bed - until he finds out who with. Comedy, starring Richard O'Sullivan.(n)

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: Rigsby lets a room to a young couple he believes have just got married - unaware that they are not man and wife. Classic comedy, starring Leonard Rossiter.(n)

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: George decides to place his father in a residential home, but the old man would rather stay with his son. Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce star.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Bellamy chases joyriders tearing through Aidensfield and accidentally runs down Don Dibley's son during the pursuit. programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica discovers a link between the death of a film fan and the supposed suicide of a leading Hollywood director 35 years previously. Murder mystery, starring Angela Lansbury and John Astin.(n)

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Chief Superintendent Jack Cornish goes missing and a recently embalmed body is discovered near an isolated farm track - could there be a link? As Hathaway goes on sabbatical in Kosovo, Lewis takes an awkward young constable under his wing to investigate the case. Guest starring Lucy Speed and Peter Davison, with Kevin Whately and Babou Ceesay.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: While working with the drug squad, Ronnie and Joe find a skeleton that has been hidden inside the boot of a car in the River Thames. It turns out to be the remains of Taylor Kane, an undercover policeman who went missing in the 1980s - around the time of the Brixton riots. Through clever detection, unsettling evidence is unearthed and the team knows it must raise issues the police would rather forget. Drama, starring Bradley Walsh and Ben Bailey Smith, and featuring one of the last performances by Roger Lloyd-Pack, who died in January.(n)

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: The master of a prestigious college asks Morse to investigate the disappearance of one of his colleagues. The subsequent discovery of a dismembered torso soon has everyone fearing the worst - until the missing man turns up alive and well. Starring John Thaw, Kevin Whately, James Grout, Beatie Edney, Sian Thomas and Barry Foster.(n)

programme.title: World Cup Rivalries
programme.sub-title: World Cup Rivalries: England v Argentina.
programme.desc: A look at the football rivalry between the nations.(n)

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against quiz expert the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.(n)

programme.title: Storage Wars: New York
programme.desc: People bid for the contents of abandoned storage units. In Harlem, two buyers purchase a container and find a biker's jacket and a fur coat worth $3,000.(n)

programme.desc: Joe P Pauletich makes a huge profit after buying a unit for $1,500 containing lots of art. Candy Olsen and Courtney Wagner purchase a locker with a rare pair of dance shoes inside.(n)

programme.title: Benidorm
programme.desc: Mateo reveals his home life is a disaster - his mother-in-law Dolores is threatening to kill him - so Lesley urges the barman to move out and start a new life. But will it be that easy? Clive, Tiger and Terri come up with a plan to retrieve Clive's 5,000 euros from dodgy property developer Monty, while Psychic Sue drops by Blow & Go with a message for Liam. Jacqueline and Glynn look forward to a reunion with their real partners, but when Riannon arrives, there's no sign of Donald. Guest starring Ruth Madoc (Hi-de-Hi!).(n)

programme.title: Eraser
programme.desc: An arms industry executive is placed in danger after she exposes evidence of illegal deals by an international corporation. The authorities respond by assigning her to the custody of a government agent who specialises in helping federal witnesses disappear from the system. However, when the operative is framed for murder, he is forced to balance his duties with efforts to clear his own name. Action thriller, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, James Caan, Vanessa L Williams and James Coburn.(n)

programme.desc: Nicki Shields, David Green and Amy Williams present action from the Goodwood Estate as motoring enthusiasts from around the world gathered for the historic car and bike event.(n)

programme.desc: Action from the fifth round of the season, which was staged at Snetterton in Norfolk. Presented by James Haydon.(n)

The first in the long-running spy thriller series, starring Sean Connery, Ursula Andress, Jack Lord and Joseph Wiseman.(n)

programme.title: Dr No

programme.title: Robin of Sherwood
programme.sub-title: The Swords of Wayland - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. Robin and the outlaws leave Sherwood to defend a distant village from a band of phantom horsemen known as the Hounds of Lucifer, who terrorise the countryside on the orders of a powerful coven ruled by Morgwyn of Ravenscar. Guest starring Rula Lenska.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: New boy Sam Morgan breaks all the rules and gets emotionally involved with a patient, jeopardising his career at the Beeches almost before it's begun. Joseph Millson stars, with Gary Mavers and Haydn Gwynne.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: The disgraced Elizabeth returns to Eaton Place with her unwanted child and former nursemaid in tow. Sarah is assigned as the nanny's helper, but becomes concerned about the elderly woman's ability to care for Lucy properly. Classic period drama, starring Gordon Jackson, Jean Marsh and Simon Williams.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: An outbreak of food poisoning hits everyone in the A&E department except David, leaving him to cope with a succession of difficult patients including an ailing Elvis impersonator and a traumatised overdose victim. At first it seems like just the opportunity he's been waiting for to prove himself - but as the pressure mounts, he's left agonising over whether to throw in the towel and call Robert Kingsford for help. David Partridge, Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack star.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick and Kate must act quickly when a woman takes an overdose, in the belief that her husband has been falsely imprisoned. Meanwhile, Phil learns Jennifer is pregnant and agrees to marry her, but may not survive his stag night at the pub. Rural drama, starring Nick Berry, Niamh Cusack and Mark Jordan.(n)

programme.title: The Grand
programme.desc: A businessman negotiates half-price rates with Marcus, but John does not agree and demands they take a vote. Drama, starring Mark McGann and Michael Siberry.(n)

programme.title: Mapp and Lucia
programme.desc: Georgie succumbs to a mystery illness and refuses to appear in public, giving rise to a flurry of speculation in Tilling and prompting Lucia to investigate. Period comedy, starring Geraldine McEwan and Nigel Hawthorne.(n)

programme.title: Robin of Sherwood
programme.sub-title: The Swords of Wayland - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Robin's sword Albion falls into the hands of Morgwyn and her coven, who prepare to use it in a ceremony to invoke the forces of evil. Michael Praed and Rula Lenska star.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Sam makes an unusual bet with a smoker anxious to quit, and Joanna confides in pub landlady Rita, while Andrew tries to help a farmer whose failing health has prompted him to run amok in Cardale, leaving a trail of devastation behind him. Joseph Millson, Haydn Gwynne and Gary Mavers star.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Kate's ex-boyfriend turns up in Aidensfield and finds himself under suspicion for a hit-and-run accident. Meanwhile, Bellamy finds himself in charge of organising a local talent contest. Rural police drama, starring Niamh Cusack and Mark Jordon.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Lady Southwold, Lady Marjorie's widowed mother, and her companion Miss Hodges arrive, throwing the household into turmoil. Later, the staff below stairs are dismayed to hear that a brooch has apparently been stolen.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: The team battles to save two youngsters with gunshot wounds. Stuart is haunted by a promise he makes to a dying man. To Mike's surprise, Cathy announces she is leaving. Christine makes a decision about her future.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: The Adventure of the Western Star.
programme.desc: A Belgian film star arrives in London and summons her friend Poirot to unravel the mysterious threats she has been receiving, which demand the return of a priceless diamond, the Western Star. Rosalind Bennett guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The detective investigates when a victim of fraud is found murdered on a golf course - but his inquiries are complicated by the discovery of a tramp's mutilated body nearby. To make matters worse, beautiful singer Bella Duveen is also around, seemingly intent on helping herself to a grim souvenir. David Suchet stars, with Hugh Fraser, Bill Moody and Jacinta Mulcahy.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The crime drama returns with an episode based on Ann Cleeves' recently published novel Harbour Street. Vera investigates the death of a pensioner found stabbed on a train at the height of rush hour. The case has a huge impact on Joe's home life when his daughter is named as a key witness, and he struggles to maintain a professional distance. The trail leads the team to a quiet Northumberland coastal town where clues appear to lead to one particular street - but why are the residents so reluctant to talk? Starring Brenda Blethyn, with David Leon, Sonya Cassidy, Jon Morrison and Eva Birthistle.(n)

programme.title: Brief Encounters
programme.desc: Going against the wishes of her family, married mother-of-one Steph makes a life-changing decision to become an Ann Summers demonstrator and run parties selling exotic lingerie. She enlists the help of her new friend Nita and persuades well-to-do acquaintance Pauline to host an evening, but fears it might not really be the right crowd to sell to. Drama set in Sheffield in 1982, starring Sophie Rundle, Penelope Wilton, Angela Griffin and Sharon Rooney.(n)

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: A career criminal is implicated in the burglary of an ex-soldier's home, but when the suspect's son confesses to the crime the police are unsure whether to believe him. The detectives believe he may be covering for his father out of loyalty, but an interview with the mother causes alarm and suggests a darker theory altogether. Drama, starring Jane Antrobus, Darren Day and Samantha Power.(n)

programme.title: Mr Selfridge
programme.desc: Harry pushes ahead with plans for the Selfridge Estate, aiming to buy a field at auction, but an unexpected rival bidder poses a threat. Kitty launches a high-profile cosmetics demonstration, getting herself into her boss's good books and landing a job for her sister Connie in the process. Miss Mardle returns to the store and makes her mark in fashion, while Henri continues to behave erratically, leaving Agnes out in the cold. Could their marriage be in trouble? Jeremy Piven stars in the period drama.(n)

programme.title: Jekyll and Hyde
programme.desc: Robert discovers he has some distant relations, so he and Max travel to the remote village where they live in the hope they will be able to tell him more about the Jekyll curse. On their arrival, they discover several mysterious deaths have occurred recently and the locals believe a legendary demonic dog is responsible. Robert discovers an ancient book that seems to reveal a connection between his relatives and Tenebrae, and suspects they are dealing with a shape-shifter. Amelia Bullmore guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A grandmother is suspected of snatching a baby from outside a shop following a family quarrel, but Kate believes one of her patients may be responsible. Meanwhile, Greengrass buys a racehorse and begins to train it on the streets of Aidensfield - much to the dismay of Sergeant Blaketon. Rural drama, starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Elizabeth joins the suffragette movement and plans a raid on a local MP's house, but it is Rose who is arrested during the ensuing scuffle and sent to Holloway Prison.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Robert shocks his partner Issy by revealing that he's prepared to pack in work to help look after their new baby, while in her boss's absence, Christine's professional judgement is tested when a burns victim faces almost certain death. With Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth heads to Lake Windermere for a holiday with faithful assistant Hastings, only to find his crime-solving skills are once again needed to investigate a murder. The only witness to the crime is a dog, leaving Poirot with a difficult task to find the killer. David Suchet stars, with Kate Buffery, Patrick Ryecart and Julia St John.(n)

programme.title: Broadchurch
programme.desc: Hardy and Ellie appeal to Trish to be more open with them as she may have information that - although not related to the attack - could help the investigation, but she is unwilling to co-operate. The officers of Broadchurch CID are slowly making their way through the painstaking process of interviewing witnesses and collecting statements and start to uncover inconsistencies and lies - and previously hidden connections between Trish and some suspects. Crime drama, with David Tennant, Olivia Colman and Julie Hesmondhalgh.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective is called in when David Kenworthy, the son of a prominent local family, is found murdered on the beach at Whitley Bay. A witness spotted arcade owner Larry Crowe arguing with David on the night of the killing, and a search of the suspect's property uncovers a bloodied baseball bat. However, Larry has a cast-iron alibi and it's clear he wasn't the only person the victim met that night. A second death then leaves Vera facing mounting pressure to crack the case, and struggling to answer the question of why David was drawn to the seafront on the evening of his father's retirement. Brenda Blethyn stars in the murder mystery, with David Leon as her trusty sidekick Joe.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The team rescues more than 200 dogs from an overpopulated puppy farm in Grimes County, Texas, and one particular canine captures the heart of investigator Scott Wernick.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The friendship between an American soldier and an injured puppy found in war-torn Iraq.(n)

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: Documentary examining the case of Patti Adkins who vanished in July 2001, shortly after leaving her shift at a Honda factory in Ohio. A police investigation revealed the 29-year-old single mother was making plans for a trip with a mystery boyfriend, but he has never been identified.(n)

programme.title: Corrupt Crimes
programme.desc: A case from 2011 when a homeless crossdresser, known as Ms Puppy, went on a killing spree. Plus, an American astronaut who sought retribution from her ex-lover's new partner.(n)

programme.title: Corrupt Crimes
programme.desc: The 1996 death of Kent Leppink. Ten years later his fiancee, an ex-stripper, was convicted for the murder, but the verdict was overturned.(n)

programme.desc: The case of 48-year-old insurance agent Bob Eidman, who was found dead in his office during daylight hours in June 2007. Locals feared a cold-blooded killer was on the loose and the matter went unresolved for more than three years until DNA evidence was unearthed.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps Teresa Lynch search for a property in the western Algarve, Portugal. With dramatically falling house prices, she hopes her budget of £120,000 will be enough to fulfil her lifelong dream of living on the country's coast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at Wizards Thatch in Alderley Edge, a village in Cheshire. Owners Ian Lambert and his partner Ali Imiolek hope to cast a spell over the competition, but their guests end up picking out problems with the continental breakfast basket.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to Blackpool, where James Reay and Simon Dooley run the one-star Winterbourne Hotel and Theatre Showbar. The contestants seem to be relaxed and impressed, but a rival's feedback sends one of the hosts storming out of the room.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Perfectionist Andrea Hickmott and her partner Nick Bonner-Williams welcome their guests to Northrise Lodge in Hastings, East Susses, but the rooms are criticised and deemed too clinical to relax in. Andrea also panics when she forgets to put sugar on the tables at breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Stephanie and Dominic Parker, (who later found fame in Gogglebox) welcome the rest of the contestants to their B&B, the Salutation in Sandwich, Kent. However, an alcohol-fuelled evening of parlour games jeopardises the hosts' chances to win the prize.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. A wedding proposal appears to be on the cards, and the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps Claire Streets and Jon Jevons find a new home in the Andalusia region of Spain. With a budget of £150,000, the Nottinghamshire couple hope to find a property with enough land for them to set up a luxury camping business.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps Richard and Janie Wood search for a new property in the Almeria region of Spain on a budget of £80,000. Richard suffers from ill health and believes his pain could be alleviated by a move to warmer climes.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team of experts set out to uncover the facts behind a collection of human bones - some of which appear to be children's - found in a Derbyshire cave. A possibly prehistoric burial mound located near the site could hold the answers.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Fetlar, Shetland Islands: The Giant's Grave.
programme.desc: The experts go in search of clues to the contents of an enigmatic cliff-top mound on Fetlar in the Shetlands known as the Giant's Grave. Battling the weather, they set out to discover whether it is connected to pieces of Viking pottery found in a nearby garden and unearth rare and extraordinary finds in three days.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Tim, Fuzz and the team work on a 1963 Alfa Romeo Giulia Spider that has been kept in a dusty barn in Essex after its owner's plans to restore it were interrupted by the onset of a serious medical condition.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A one-year-old St Bernard suffering with hip dysplasia is brought to the clinic by the Warden family. Having recently lost the the dog's brother to a similar illness, emotions are running high. Meanwhile, Noel treats a 13-year-old Collie that has been hit by a car, and tries to devise a new bionic paw for a cat with a badly deformed hind foot.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A four-year-old chinchilla arrives for surgery on a broken leg, but his tiny airways and bones make it a difficult procedure. Meanwhile, a puppy is rushed to the veterinary practice after being hit by a van, and Noel must deal with the risk of infection as he fights to save its limb. Plus, a Labrador undergoes an awkward operation for two bulging discs.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: In 2010, Claire Farrow and Ian Hogarth built a home containing a sauna, spa, dance floor and DJ booth on a small patch of land in Kensington, central London. It was a notorious project with several setbacks - including their digger smashing into a neighbour's wall and the re-emergence of the old river under the building. These threatened to prevent them completing the project, but two years later Kevin McCloud revisits the duo to see how things have progressed.(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes
programme.desc: New series. Cameras follow people who live and work in the national parks, beginning with the residents of Bleak Bank Farm in the Dales.(n)

programme.title: The Baby Boomers' Guide to Growing Old
programme.desc: A coach-load of greying, good-time ladies help Roy Hudd cheer up John Prescott as the series takes a wry look at leisure, and seasoned celebrities having the time of their lives.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits some of the restaurants that he set out to save, including The Mixing Bowl, The Olde Stone Mill, Peter's and Campania. Have their owners pulled themselves out of their nightmares?.(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes
programme.desc: New series. Cameras follow people who live and work in the national parks, beginning with the residents of Bleak Bank Farm in the Dales.(n)

programme.title: The Baby Boomers' Guide to Growing Old
programme.desc: A coach-load of greying, good-time ladies help Roy Hudd cheer up John Prescott as the series takes a wry look at leisure, and seasoned celebrities having the time of their lives.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: In 2010, Claire Farrow and Ian Hogarth built a home containing a sauna, spa, dance floor and DJ booth on a small patch of land in Kensington, central London. It was a notorious project with several setbacks - including their digger smashing into a neighbour's wall and the re-emergence of the old river under the building. These threatened to prevent them completing the project, but two years later Kevin McCloud revisits the duo to see how things have progressed.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps a Nottinghamshire couple search for a new house with enough land for them to set up a luxury camping business in Andalucia, southern Spain.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: B&B veteran Paul Workman, who runs Hamlet House in Stratford-upon-Avon, makes the most of his town's Shakespeare connection as another round of the competition gets under way - but his guests cause a fuss when a hair is found in the mushrooms at breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to B&B novices Ben Gray and Katie Keegan's Ashlack business in Cumbria. The guests admire rooms in the estate's 17th-century manor house, but Veronica Pickles and Saida Hammoud are unimpressed when they discover their accommodation is a yurt in the woods. Filled with dread at the idea of a midnight trip to the toilet facilities, they later make plain their feelings when checking out.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to the Richwood in Torquay, where partners Veronica Pickles and Saida Hammoud run the 13-bedroom guest house by themselves. The diners are given a crash course in belly-dancing and provided with a feast of Lebanese delicacies - but are soon distracted by the dated decor.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Helen Fraser welcomes her guests to the Tai'r Bull Inn in the Brecon Beacons, with moral support from her friend Kath. Ben and Katie are quick to praise the quality of their lodgings, but B&B veteran Paul spots a few mistakes, while Saida and Veronica refuse to spend the night in their room after they make a discovery.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The four sets of owners meet one last time to discover how much their rivals thought they should receive and to settle some scores. A clash then ensues between two of the week's hosts before the winner of the competition is revealed.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi tries to help Sheffield couple Chris and Lynn Simmerson find their ideal retirement home on Spain's Costa Blanca and discovers their £80,000 budget stretches further than expected.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Property expert Sara Damergi helps Mark Shaw and Wlan Amorim from London search for their ideal holiday home in the historical centre of Valencia - one of Spain's biggest cities. The pair have a budget of £100,000 and chef Wlan is unable to compromise on the size of the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: The experts visit the Naval College and Maritime Museum in Greenwich, which stands on the site of Henry VIII's favourite palace. They have just three days to locate the missing jousting yard, where the king indulged his love of the sport, and the armoury - offering Phil Harding the chance to model some authentic protective equipment of the time.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team embark on another excavation, searching for Liberty's first silk factory in south London. The archaeologists try to re-create the 19th-century techniques of dyeing and printing that would have been used - and the frustrating dig finally yields results on the last day.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend head to Hampshire to repair a VW Golf GTI Mk1 that has been kept in a garage since a road accident in 2001. However, they both have different ideas about how the finished car should look when it is returned to its owner.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A woman and her sons bring in their springer spaniel puppy for complicated surgery on its badly deformed hind leg. Meanwhile, the owner of an eight-year-old cocker spaniel waits to hear if her dog's cancer has spread, and the vet treats a two-year-old cat, which is dragging one of its back legs.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A woman who suffers from nocturnal epileptic fits brings in Pearl, a Staffordshire Bull Terrier that can sense when her episodes are about to happen. However, the dog has problems with its knees and struggles to walk, so the pressure is on for Professor Noel Fitzpatrick to restore it back to full health. Plus, an Irish Setter has a cancerous tumour in its front leg, and a cat needs its jaw wiring back together after being hit by a car.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Architect Henning Stummel and his partner Alice Dawson plan to convert a dilapidated joinery workshop in north London into a contemporary family home and office. They want to preserve the building's original steel frame, but to restore it they will have to take it down, which means carefully extracting it from the neighbours' walls without causing damage to their property - and that's just the start of the couple's problems. Kevin McCloud follows their progress.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: A couple who have given themselves just two weeks to construct their new home in beachside Maianbar, south of Sydney, despite the fact that they have never built anything before.(n)

programme.title: The Secrets of Sleep
programme.desc: A 36-year-old who has finally received a diagnosis of narcolepsy and a 20-year-old whose horrifying night terrors are keeping her trapped in her bedroom. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the popular quiz as Sean Lock and David Mitchell compete against Jon Richardson and Katherine Ryan. The Brett Domino Trio join Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

They dominate the land with their intelligence, charisma, and courage. Truly Africa's finest. But now it is time to find a new Big Five. America's Big Five. North America wants to take a shot at the game and see if they can compete with Africa's beasts. America's Greatest Animals nominates twelve candidates that have the characteristics that make them worthy of the chase. Each challenger will be judged on adaptation, appearance, intelligence, size, and weaponry. Who is worthy enough to be one of AMERICA'S BIG FIVE?(n)

programme.title: Full House
programme.desc: Sisterly Love. Despite the negative experience of appearing in a TV promo in the previous episode, DJ (Candace Cameron) accepts the leading role in her school play--and is convinced that she is on the road to stardom. DJ begs Danny (Bob Saget) to let her audition for a TV cereal commercial, only to be consumed by jealousy when her sister Stephanie (Jodie Sweetin) gets the job instead. This is the first episode in which Stephanie utters her familiar catchphrase "How rude"--and rude DJ is, in abundance, until Jesse (John Stamos) and Joey (David Coulier) step in to resolve the problem(n)

programme.title: Full House
programme.desc: Half a Love Story. Visiting Danny (Bob Saget) at the TV station, Jesse (John Stamos) falls for station employee Robin Winslow (Kristian Alfonso). Unfortunately, Robin isn't fond of Jesse's "type"--and even more unfortunately, she seems to prefer the company of Danny. But the trouble doesen't really begin until another of Jesse's acquaintances, a girl named Jill (Darcy DeMoss), shows up at the Tanner house at the same time as Robin(n)

programme.title: Full House

The robot is forced to agree to merge his programming with his former lover's, while Fry and Leela desperately try to shut her down before she can fly them all into a quasar. Featuring the voices of Sigourney Weaver and Lucy Liu.(n)

In LA he hangs out with some hip-hop clowns, experiences a day of beauty with a plastic-surgery addict and gives up his possessions to see if the simple life is the answer to contentment.(n)

programme.title: Andromeda

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong.(n)

programme.title: Supergirl

programme.title: The Flash

programme.title: The Blacklist

programme.title: The Force: Manchester

programme.title: Storm City

programme.title: Storm City
programme.desc: Four-part documentary in which Ben Fogle explores the devastating impact of extreme weather, finding out what happens when man is pitted against the power of Mother Nature. In the final programme, he discovers how earthquakes wreak so much havoc. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor uncovers the gossip, intrigue and scandal lurking behind the closed doors of some of the world's most famous rooms and suites. He visits the Chateau Marmont on Hollywood's Sunset Boulevard, where Howard Hughes famously holed up in the penthouse, Jean Harlow and Clark Gable carried out a torrid affair and Lindsay Lohan was recently temporarily banned for not paying a bill. In New York, he talks to former mobster Louis Ferrante about a robbery at the Pierre Hotel in 1972 in which cash and jewellery worth $10million was stolen.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor learns what it means to be treated like a VIP in some of the world's finest hotels. He heads to the Harlequin Suite at London's Dorchester, where Elizabeth Taylor had a pink marbled bathroom installed. He also visits Paris's Le Meurice, the place Salvador Dali returned to every year for 30 years. He meets the surrealist artist's muse Amanda Lear, who talks about his antics, as well as how his legacy is celebrated in the hotel today. In America, Richard gets a true taste of the lifestyle of the megarich when he orders the $5,000 fleurburger at the Mandalay Bay Hotel in Las Vegas.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Toby's old friend contacts him, ready to blow the whistle about his employer's violations of environmental laws, while Amy is given the task of convincing the president to threaten a veto on a foreign aid bill containing an anti-abortion proviso. Will puts a political face on the destruction and deaths resulting from the melting of an Alaskan glacier. US drama, guest starring Mary-Louise Parker.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Air Force One is forced to stay in the air for 24 hours when the crew suspect the landing gear to be faulty, and as tensions rise, the passengers and ground crew begin to wonder whether the plane has been sabotaged. Drama, starring Martin Sheen and Joshua Malina.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: The development of London during the Victorian era, as the city at the heart of the British empire rapidly expanded - and social divisions became increasingly pronounced. The programme explores the grandeur of the period, including the building of the Crystal Palace, as well as sharp rises in vice and crime that prompted outrage among reformers including Charles Dickens and Josephine Butler. There is also a look at how football became increasingly popular.(n)

programme.desc: The actor discovers some of the hidden extras on offer in the world's most expensive hotels. At the Hotel Bel-Air in Los Angeles, Richard talks to a wedding planner who has organised nuptials for celebrities including Gwen Stefani, Nicole Richie and Katy Perry, and he also chats to Kiss bassist Gene Simmons and Cosmopolitan editor-in-chief Joanna Coles.(n)
